caption: I have been the loyal member of the Projector for 4 years plus and I am very appreciated that Singapore is having such a place to chill out other than mainstream cinemas. And I am so glad that the projector survive and thrive through the difficult period of pandemic and now doing great with different outlets other than here. They offer annual membership including four free tickets and after that you can buy tickets using member price. The have a wide selection of movies you won‚Äôt find else where mainstream cinemas in Singapore, some indie or featured work from a rising star director. Other than watching it in golden mile tower or other location, they also offer a streaming service that you can rent the movies. The outlet itself also keeps the nostalgia vibe of 80‚Äôs, the seating in the cinema remain the same as you were a time traveler. Some rooms also have the seating like sofa and beanbags, isn‚Äôt it cool .. I like they really put into thought on the decorations to keep the old and new in the same place which is interesting enough to attract the youngsters. On the way to the rest room, they have a large mural wall and sometimes you will see influencers taking pictures there. Here also have a bar providing simple food and beverages, my go to order every time is iced coffee, come here and enjoy and definitely a place to give you the energy
name: The Projector

caption: Last I came by, it was for a corporate screening of Lei Yuan Bin's Baby Queen during Pride Month 2023. Enjoyed the documentary and the performances that followed. As another reviewer has written, the seats in another hall are 'steeply tiered'. It can feel dangerous walking in between the rows of seats at the back of that hall, but I suppose if earlier generations could do it, so can we. I used to work at Sinema Old School, and I tend to think of The Projector as its descendant in spirit.
name: The Projector

caption: Great vibes, cool film selections and at decent prices too. All that and you can have a pint while watching! Loads of curated specials from V-Day movies (Wong Kar Wai! Beautiful choice.) to film festival screenings to music events‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs truly something for everybody :)
name: The Projector

caption: Old school vibes though ventilation felt weak and mixed with bar food and dust. Cinema seats are steeply tiered.
name: The Projector

caption: Very unique art house Cinema with a retro inventory, that has been chosen by heart an passion for cinematography to give this beautiful cinema a real soul! ‚ù§Ô∏è  I really liked the vibe, the ambiente and the people üé•  Tickets could easily be bought online for 11,50 S$ per adult. Happy hours are from 5 to 8 pm.  Great place to see movies, can only strongly recommend ‚úåüèº
name: The Projector

caption: the perfect hangout place for cinephiles. interior is very artsy, film selection is quite diverse. i signed up for the projector fan club for the free tix and discounts which is a quite a steal especially if you plan on visiting quite often.
name: The Projector

caption: Used to go here almost every month during my hipster phase in uni. Just went back to catch Decision To Leave yesterday and enjoyed myself. Building is super old but adds to the vibe.
name: The Projector

caption: Awesome vibe, perfect place for hipsters to enjoy a movie! It‚Äôs like you‚Äôre watching a movie back in the good old days of cinema. Complete old school experience with the hollow acoustics, imperfectly comfortable seats, and IPA draft (comes with a free holder aka your thigh).
name: The Projector

caption: Still my favourite place in Singapore. Thank you for all the great movies and amazing memories I had here.
name: The Projector

caption: I went there just because I want to use the photoautomat and it was very nice, you can exchange your money to coins to use the photobooth, but it will be very nice of you if you also buy a drink from the bar. For you people who love photograph, it is a nice place to get your shot here.
name: The Projector

caption: Food and drinks menu is the same as the one Projector: Picturehouse however there way more vintage stuff to see here, paintings and murals on the walls, even posters in the toilet.  The seats are much less comfortable compared to picturehouse though, no cupholder to put your drinks and the seats are vintage.  There are beanbags you can lie on to watch the movie if you desire.  Highly recommend the triple grilled cheese sandwich and the beef sausage bun, haram teh was amazing too.
name: The Projector

caption: Absolutely loved catching and indie Japanese film here. The vibe of the whole cinema is awesome. Very retro, groovy and artsy. Loved the pre-movie video for turning your phone off - it had everyone laughing! Feels like you're stepping out of time and out of Singapore in the Projector! Highly recommend!
name: The Projector

caption: An extremely unique cinema with a Gen Z vibe environment that is picturesque, unique and a worthy cinema worth experiencing in Singapore. Truly a once in a lifetime cinema that is extremely different than most cinemas. Love the Vibes, Happy Hour (till 8pm on Weekdays). Fun fact: you can bring all their food and drinks into the cinemas (alcohol served there as well)
name: The Projector

caption: Old school movie theater with lots of retro props from the 80's.  The vibe is cool, but the area is a bit ghetto.
name: The Projector

caption: I love it for the relaxed and retro atmosphere, selection of quality movies and alternative vibes. Seats in the green room could be more comfortable.
name: The Projector

caption: Awesome n perfect place to enjoy a movie! It‚Äôs like watching a movie back in the good old days cinema, old school experience!
name: The Projector

caption: First time here and it was definitely awesome experience. You can grab food and drinks (from coffee to wine) they have variety of food selection. So many picture perfect spot. üòä ‚Ä¶
name: The Projector

caption: Cool space, friendly staff and had fun with the photo booth! Theatre was alright, not too hot or cold :-) Hope to come back again, love the cute straws they got
name: The Projector

caption: The halls are generally rather rundown and the seats old. When you take a seat initially, there will be creaky noises without fail. The steps in the bigger hall can be steep.  Only Blue hall has the washrooms just outside, making it the most accessible. BUT, only 2 cubicles for ladies AND 1 cubicle has been CLOSED for repairs for so many months! Wonder why?  Update: both cubicles are available for use! Hurray
name: The Projector

caption: Always a great time at the Projector. We‚Äôll definitely miss the spot at the Golden Mile.
name: The Projector

caption: Interesting space with retro hipster vibes. Seats are a little old and narrow but otherwise good sound system and cinema.
name: The Projector

caption: I liked it, a bit cold but very nice place to see a movie
name: The Projector

caption: loved the experience! I didn't so much like the popcorn- I got the cinnamon one but it wasn't glazed like I thought it would be so it was so-so to me though those who don't mind unglazed popcorn might like it! Their thai milk tea was nice, though. The theatre was nice and comfy and they have these pamphlets for the month's screenings out to take that are really cute! I watched Crimes of the Future here and #traumatised...just kidding HAHA no but really. Had a great experience!
name: The Projector

caption: Old but charming cinema! I love the movies being shown here.
name: The Projector

caption: Cool place for movies and drinks, always love the film selection/ curation
name: The Projector

caption: My favorite cinema in Singapore for the fantastic curation of independent and foreign movies. Brings back memories of the 80s when this same cinema was the nearest to my grandparents' place so I was actually here as a little kid! Even though the place is old, it's been spruced up super nice and clean. I also love that I can have a glass of wine with the movie - or at least that was the case before the lockdown. I'm so glad this place survived the lockdown and can't wait to be back!
name: The Projector

caption: Watched Park Chan-wook's "Decision to Leave", great sound system, love that they let us bring bar bites (seafood wontons with chilli crab sauce is mind-blowing btw) and drinks into the theatre. Cozy ambience and confortable seats, will return!
name: The Projector

caption: I always come back to watch hard to catch movies here. The food here is pretty great as well, a bit pricey but big portions!
name: The Projector

caption: Place gave a retro feel, which was interesting, but the customer service was unsatisfactory.  It was not clear that we needed to sit 2 seats apart, and we were forced to move seats right before the movie started. This created a lot of inconvenience as the room was dark.  Furthermore, there was poor enforcement of this rule. We were forced to move despite having arrived earlier than a group of 4 people to our right (who also did not follow the 2 seats apart rule) but were allowed to move one seat to the right, leaving no seats left for us to follow the rule.  We had to find new seats in the dark when most people were already seated and hence had to move to the back. We came early to get good seats for a reason and it was supposed to be free seating.  This has ruined the movie experience for us.  UPDATE(7 Sept 2022): Despite the offer of movie vouchers as seen in their reply, I have been waiting for almost 2 years for these vouchers to materialise. Take it as you will.
name: The Projector

caption: First time here and it was truly impressive! We took the massage and onsen access set menu which is really worthy in our opinion.  Convenient location, just right out of stadium station and follow the direction signage to Yunomori. Fast check-in process. Clear instructions inside the onsen area and many staff to help you out. My friend was very satisfied with the skill of the masseur.  Definitely worth a visit and we will be back!
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: The last time I visited this place was more than a year ago, nothing much has changed.  The staff at reception counter were polite, service was ok but they left new customers‚Äô application forms lying at the counter without covering the personal particulars.  The staff at the changing room cleaned and wiped the floor dry prompted. It would be great if they could remind inconsiderate customers to close the doors when entering or leaving the onsen area.  There onsen bath was good with cold, hot, bubble, jet bath, etc.  The changing room was still cramped, about 3-4 dryers were available. That‚Äôs nothing much they could do unless re-renovate the place.  The staff at the cafe were friendly and polite. The food was average or above average which was totally acceptable given the reasonable pricing.  Have not tried their massage, no comment.  Overall good experience and it would be more pleasant if verbal education/reminders can be given to customers to bathe before going into the onsen, close the door when entering and leaving the onsen.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: A place where one can really spend an entire day in. I normally soak, come out to eat, soak again. You can have massages or just rest and nap in the resting area. Food wise, menu is comprehensive and they served melon milk, banana milk etc, completing the onsen experience well!  I have tried half the menu and so far none disappoints me.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Enjoyed a 30 min head and shoulders massage, onsen and a nice Japanese lunch here. No need to be in Japan to have a chillax time.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: I used to give this place 5 stars and I even sign up a membership with them. However, recently, not only the prices went up but even if you do their massages, not all massages come with onsen entry anymore. Quality of the cafe also has dropped. They used to have my favourite ginger tea but the recipe now is diluted and only tasted sweet. I'm sad cause I have to find a new spa place.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Place cannot take alot photo so jus one to sum up. Its very clean and neat place. Every ladies know how to maintain the place when using it. Even after shower we have that simple gesture to push in the stool n over turn the pail. Place is very well maintain. Quiet. Good to relax if  u are tired with household. This definitely a place to relax
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Had a deep-sleep massage + Onsen for first tine experience here and it did not disappointment me instead impressed me with the very relaxing 60 min massage, serene ambiance, yummy food and unintimidating onsen. It's worth every $ experience. Im so gonna bring my children next time so they can experience the onsen. Renting/wearing Yukata and Obi is such a cute part in this experience so I made sure I take photos. Onsen has 6 baths and a sauna room which i believe one can stay 1-2hours. Their locker/shower area at onsen has all the toiletries and necessities provided including a hair dryer. Really worth the $ must try!
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Today the onsen is really crowed due to holiday season. I don‚Äôt understand why they allow chopping seat! So many people come in and out to seek to a space to rest. While some brainless one chopping the seat and missing few hours
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Great onsen experience with nearly all the traditional features. Wonderful to have a steam room and sauna. Chic features and furniture. Would recommend - just follow the signs!
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Really looking forward to my trip here as I couldn't stand this rainy CNY season anymore and I'm due for a much needed break after working for 2 weeks straight without a day off until today so naturally I have high expectations  I was there from 2 to 9pm. Staffs are hospitable and helpful, they will ask if you're a first timer and guide you through the onsen steps. Environment is very comfortable and clean, after taking my first onsen dip I head to the cafe for salmon chawanmushi, food was not hot enough but still quite tasty. Then I took a nap at the lounge for an hour or two. Temperature was just right and I doze off right away after food & onsen.  Woke up and went for a second dip, this time more people, around 10-15 even on a monday. Had to queue for awhile to use the hairdryer but all basic amenities were provided (comb, ear buds, body lotion, towels, yukata, body and hair shampoo). Then I had the Tonkotsu Ramen for dinner and my god it was exceptional. Best chashu I've ever tasted! Charred just the right amount and the broth is light so it's not overwhelming. Decided to try the chocolate lava cake for dessert, the lava itself is quite sweet accompanied with strawberries, the cake itself is not sweet so I suggest eating them together.  Then I've decided to go for a final quick dip before I leave. Discarded my used towel earlier so I had to pay another $3 for a big towel which is fair.  Overall I enjoyed trying different baths especially when dipping into the cold bath after the hot ones, you'll immediately get a rush straight to your head (not for everyone, be cautious). My muscles immediately doesn't ache anymore and the experience is very refreshing. Thank you so much, I'm very much rejuvenated ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: It‚Äôs a great place for some relaxing me time! Too bad I didn‚Äôt manage to book the massage. They have a variety of hot baths which you can take your time to enjoy. Quite spacious. Food at the cafe was pretty decent. And I absolutely love the resting lounge - can really fall asleep there. Affordable one day pass.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: 1st time trying onsen. Good experience, and the staff will guide you along. They provide disposable tube and panties as well. No phones are allowed during onsen, which is good because you get to enjoy the time together w friends.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: My experience here was good! The baths here have good variety and are at the perfect temperature for me. My favourite was the silk bath which made my skin feel so smooth after! There are adequate amenities here for female. The dressing room has hair oil, hair tonic, body cream, hair bands, hair dryer, etc. the bathroom provides shampoo, conditioner and body wash. There‚Äôs also a water cooler outside the baths.  Do note that you are not allowed to take pictures in the dressing room. But i saw one lady trying to snap a picture, so do be aware of your surroundings and kindly remind ignorant people who tries to go against the rules.  Cafe food was decent and the milk, which everyone should totally get after their onsen, was decently good as well.  One sad thing though is the resting lounge which has too little sofa for their guests.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Nice place for soak and relax your muscles. The tonkatsu ramen is great and even better than the ramen I had at many Japanese restaurants.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: I was unfortunate enough to encounter two very loud and selfish women who chatted loudly and non-stop in the Onsen area. I asked a staff to go in to tell them to be quiet. When I returned a few minutes later, those women were still talking and have not softened their voices. Obviously your staff didn‚Äôt deliver the warning sufficiently. When groups check-in, your staff should remind them no talking in the Onsen area and that they will be asked to leave if found to be disturbing the ambience of the area. I noticed several other ladies looked annoyed and stared at them too but were probably too polite to complain.  I‚Äôd love to return but only if management takes it seriously to do something about teaching the right etiquette to clients. I have noticed previous reviews that this issue have been raised and yet it seems your staff is still not handling it properly.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Having visited the Bangkok Yunomori Spa, this is a much smaller establishment compared to the Bangkok one. The onsen pool is slightly smaller, perhaps missing the outdoor pool and magnesium pool. Locker room is pretty small but well equipped although the lockers are really too small to be useful. Food wise needs improvement. There is lounging area but the aircon really not working well.. and too stuffy to rest there.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Japanese style Onsen & Spa. You are not allowed to take photos in the Onsen & Spa area, but the foyer is fine.  There's props like umbrella, wooden geta etc at the foyer. You can take nice pictures with the green bamboo backdrop there too.  You get to pick the design of kimono inside the Onsen & Spa & you can head out to the foyer for some nice pictures.  They have several modern onsen baths like silk bath, jet bath, cold bath, Soda bath etc. Steam & Sauna room beside the onsen baths too.  There's a cafe inside the premise where they sell Japanese food like curry rice, Chawanmushi, nigiri, salad, rice bowl etc. You won't be hungry while enjoy a full day of Spa!  I highly recommend you to check this place out!
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: The local onsen to go to if you miss the real ones in Japan. Love their hot and cold pool. The ambience is amazing and really induces deep relaxation. Had some hit and miss experience with their massage service though. I hope they will stay open till 12am for those who come after work and a slow dinner.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Honestly, way pricier than its value. Onsen baths include the bubble bath, the sleeping jet baths, the silk bath and the yunomori signature and the cold.  Baths are quite poorly maintained, steam room is quite dirty despite the refreshing lemongrass fragrance- spa uses strong smelling essential oils which masks the damp and unclean odour. Dressing room is very nice, showrr area is very clean. Love the indoor restaurant but the food is over priced as well..
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: A relaxing place to be in. They have several baths to choose from, a sauna and steam room. There's also a cold bath. The place is clean & safe. Food there is also good. If you want to take it further, you can have massage etc here too.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Writing with deep dissatisfaction and disappointment with the services provided by Yunomori Spa's management on the handling of the membership credits after the covid pandemic period. During the COVID-19 pandemic period, when Yunomori spa services were temporarily unavailable and restricted due to government regulations and health concerns, it is disheartening to learn that your company did not provide any notification and proper extension for consumers to utilise expiry credits. As a result, many of us were unable to redeem the services we had paid for, thereby incurring a significant financial loss. I believe it is the responsibility of your reputable brand and spa business to act ethically and fairly, especially in times of unforeseen circumstances like the global pandemic. Failing to provide a reasonable extension to customers is an unfair business practice and demonstrates a lack of consideration for your loyal patrons. As a last resort and after multiple tries to request extension, I have resorted to this review and will be bringing this up with Consumers Association of Singapore (CASE) through the dispute process.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Went on a thursday from 11am+ till 4pm and there were on average <10 people in the baths so there isnt any wait/crowd. Disposable undergarments are given for free if you request for them (most ladies would wear it). There were 5 different baths but 4 of them are of the same temperature and the last 1 is cold bath. Would be better if there‚Äôs more variation in the temperatures. Only 1 of the jet bath is stronger than the rest, but even then was not very shiok as a massage. If only there were jets for neck and shoulder too. 3 vanity stations were almost not enough when i was getting ready at 3pm+. Lounge was chill and quiet with many long individual couches so you can read/use phone/sleep there. Cafe food was alright, had tonkatsu ramen and the chashu were nice and thick. Overall a relaxing experience!
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Water temperature is not regulated. Very hot sometimes till its very uncomfortable... use to have pail of water for people to rinse before entering different saunas. Very dirty. Steam room need to be cleaned hourly by staff at least spray water around the place. And add some peppermint essential oil instead of throwing the hair spray. Towels given are very dirty and turned black.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Please extend the operation hour to previous 11pm. I knew 2am was a history before covid but 10pm closing is kind of early.  Especially when the place is so crowded during peak hour, an extension of closing hour will help a lot to reduce the crowd control.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: The onsen area had 1 cold pool, 4 warm pools (silk bath, Sakura bath, hydrogen bath and massage bath) and 1 sauna. It was also smaller than expected. Nonetheless, it served the purpose of soothing aching muscles. I also went for the Thai massage and the therapist was very skilful. The staff were very kind and even offered to take a photo of myself posing with the Yukata. I enjoyed myself during the session but perhaps was not used to the quick changes of hot vs cold water treatment so I fell sick after.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: What a great place to have an au natural mineral spring bath house and a great Herbal Massage. Total bliss. Of course if you can wear the an underwear they provide. You come out so refreshed and relaxed. The staff take care of your every need. Then when your hungry just head down to the Japanese restaurant for an excellent meal, tasty fruit juices and you must have the milk to replenish and hydrate. You'll also look good in the Yukata. Thank you Yunomori Onsen.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Very expensive but it's super relaxing if you time it right and visit them when they don't have a lot of people. Relax area is very pleasant. Food they sell is also not bad at all & lots of healthy options  My only issue is that their hot tubs are very lukewarm, all of them except cold baths only 38~39 degrees cecius so it takes a considerable amount of time inside to really heat up your body. Would be great if they had a higher temp option around 43 ~ 46
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Here for the May baby promotion. The staff handled the onslaught of people quite well that day. First time at this onsen, and having been to a few I gotta say I like the Japanese theme. From the yakuta, clean interior design and the many types of baths. The signature bath with essential oils was my favourite and ended the soak in the cold bath. The rest area was quite peaceful and the cafe was constantly crowded. Ordered a fruit juice to cool off.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Went with my young girl (20 Jun 2023, 2pm). It was pretty exciting to go in, to walk in barefoot, to choose your yutaka... The front desk gentlemen was very friendly so it was a warm welcome. The lady inside explained the rules but done very quickly so took a while to understand for a first timer.  Great points: The spas were wonderful...we loved the: - the onsen experience of taking a shower seated next to your child - the warm water hugging your body and the tiredness all away, leaving us both relaxed and both slept super well at night - the different pools and their texture - a small cafe an option for food, in between our soaks, came out for cake, drinks and fried chicken. We brought some books to read and then took a 5min nap for the fun of it. - the tag that they give you is great too, keeps all your things safe. - Honestly $48 for entry is quite good since most 1hour massages are way more expensive.  What could be improved: - the left side bubble bath one of the individual pods were down and it seems that the remaining 4, 1 was much stronger and shioker than the rest, better if can have all of them of the same consistency - Kids portion for menu would be good like fried chicken or nuggets with fries - more ice cream choices - towel situation: you are given one small towel and a larger towel but you can only bring the smaller one into the shower cum onsen area. Yet you need to dry yourself after your shower before you enter the locker room, which is strange because your large towel you cannot bring into the shower area. Not sure if i misunderstood the rules.  Will i come back? yes if i cannot go a real onsen then i guess this will do but perhaps alone or with another adult who will enjoy a longer soak. though my child did ask me to bring her back..
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: Extremely Poor counter service.  My mum is an elderly and she has forgotten to take her NRIC, but instead has her Merdeka card available. I asked if she can consider providing the feedback to the company since it‚Äôs standard requirement in SG and it‚Äôs align with their company policy for elderly discount, a very dismissal attitude was provided and she asked me to file a compliant instead.  It‚Äôs shocking to see the service level to degenerate in such a way! If there‚Äôs no intent to service elderly  - then don‚Äôt market the company as if it‚Äôs elderly friendly.

caption: Best to go to this onsen on a weekday when it is quieter. I was there on a CNY public holiday and it was packed. The relaxation lounge was fully occupied.  A Japanese patron put his book on the bed to "reserve" the spot. However, he was nowhere to be seen. Another patron was turning on his phone loudly.  Kids were making noise in this area. When the hair gel was depleted, I politely told the staff to refill the bottle and they reluctantly filled it up to one inch of height.  They explained that patrons steal the hair gel, even though I could offer another explanation that heavy usage led to the diminishing of the hair gel. The water in the pool was a bit murky. I recommend not to come during the weekends or public holidays.

caption: It‚Äôs functional but not ‚Äúnice‚Äù. No relaxing atmosphere, no place to lie down to rest in-between Sauna visits (as one should) and not well maintained (tiles falling off, rust in many places, etc). No changing cabins, no standing showers. It‚Äôs like a provincial Onsen in Japan, yet the price is like a 5-Star Onsen in Japan or Sauna in Europe. I‚Äôd only go back because this is the only option for an Onsen in Singapore. Other places are even smaller and have more of a Spa atmosphere with many missing ice cold baths‚Ä¶ what bothers me is that they asked for an IC when this is not legally allowed in Singapore. When asked they told me that‚Äôs because they‚Äôre associated with the Singapore Police Force which is most certainly not true.

caption: There is always feeling of being crowded. A little small. At the very least, I would like to need cell phone charging and Wi-Fi spot.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: -was clueless when i saw the no shoes beyond this point sign at the entrance. should state of website to put shoes in lockers provided before checking in. -onsen facilities werent as amazing as i expected, other than the silk bath and steam room, the rest of the baths felt like heated swimming pools, also because of the slight chlorine smell. However considering the affordable price ($40.66) for a whole day, its very worth it. took my time trying out every bath, facilities were very clean and the signs made everything easy to understand! -black disposable bra and underwear provided, dont have to strip naked in the onsen if you dont want to. -went on a monday afternoon and there were around 20 people in the onsen, shower area and locker room. -the staff at both the cafe and onsen were very helpful and friendly, one of the malay cleaner aunties saw me struggling with my obi (yukata sash) and helped me to tie it, i felt so loved 10/10 customer service haha. for a more seamless experience, practice at home before coming. -hair tonic, body lotion, conditioner, hairdryer all provided. -resting lounge was so comfortable that i fell asleep for 1h+ . -I tried the unagi ochazuke ($13 something) and manga smoothie ($6 something) both were delicious, but the ochazuke is not worth it if you are looking for something filling (at least need 2 bowls to feel full). -stayed for about 5 hours with the onsens, eating, and napping. even went back for another dip after my nap, felt so refreshed and relaxed by the time i left, much needed break.  overall, im very satisfied and feel that its definitely a worthwhile experience! affordable price and up-to-standard facilities. however, front desk staff could be more friendly (no eye contact/smile) and could be more first-timer friendly by providing instructions on how to wear the yukata, cafe food is also a little expensive, but delicious.
name: Yunomori Onsen & Spa

caption: There are many secrets held in this temple. Beyond its beauty and history, the truth of this temple is the spiritual possibility one can access here. One of the most famous and popular aspect of this temple is the spiritual connection of Yue Lao (Moon Elder). Here is where endless individuals come to pray for help/blessings to meet a serious marriage partner. Everyday, you will find nervous individuals queuing up to petition for one. Something few know is that you can also be asking the very same spiritual connection aka deity for help with good relationship at work! And only recently, I realised personally that you can also ask for help to heal your broken heart. Not to ask to meet someone but just to be healed and it doesn't have to be broken from love relationships. It can be from anything.  Just follow the basic practice of kneeling and announcing your full name out loud (softly under your breath) AND your full birthdate and place of birth. There is more but this shall suffice. And don't just dash off after you had uttered your wishes. Stay quiet and inward. Let yourself receive inspiration and help.  Good luck.
name: Yueh Hai Ching Temple

caption: the mini figurines are intricate. peaceful place. unique location, right in the middle of high rise CBD.
name: Yueh Hai Ching Temple
opening_hours: Wednesday, 8 am to 5 pm; Thursday, 8 am to 5 pm; Friday, 8 am to 5 pm; Saturday, 8 am to 5 pm; Sunday, 8 am to 5 pm; Monday, 8 am to 5 pm; Tuesday, 8 am to 5 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: interesting place; replete with restored timber back in the 1990s, bas reliefs and murals are authentic and quite old as well as the effigies of gods used in worship, all beautifully and intricately carved altars in gold paint and the whole outfit is still being looked after by the Ngee Ann Kongsi in Singapore.  I went there to take a look because local internet gossip claimed it as the efficacious "Temple Of Love" after a thai national woman said she found her Singaporean husband by appealing to the God of Matchmaking "Êúà‰Ω¨‚Äú for supernatural assistance.  My profound respects to the Taoist Belief system, and those who venture to these holy places with sincerity with their hearts for a loving worthy mate, BUT i think these people should ask themselves what are they willing to do for such a prospective mate. What are their motivations for wanting such a mate and if they themselves are truly worthy of their ideal mates ( i overheard iterations of Singaporean "È´òÂØåÂ∏Ö" for husbands, but statistically not that many around).  I witnessed fathers and mothers with exasperated looks trying to ask the gods to help palm their lacklustre daughters  ( check her dress, attitude, mannerisms, rudeness, and sheer callousness to other worshippers and tourists around them) off on some prospective guy, maybe should pray for gods to make their daughters become "virtuous wife" material first as a fair match.  I am also unsure if their daughters prefer partners of a more Sapphic nature -- maybe they should save up a trip to New Taipei City to WeimingTang and ask the Rabbit God for helpüòÖüòÅüåà. There are also many other foreign women wanting to find a local guys as husbands, and one wonders would any local guys do for them as prospective mate, as long as they hold a Singapore Passport?  We can see how it's a tough gig for a God of Matchmaking to balance between fairness for the unwitting prospective mates out there being strung up by YueLao at the behest of these women.  And on behalf of Objectivity and Fairness and every unwitting guy and gal out there, my ardent prayer for all is this:  May Êúà‰Ω¨  find for each and everyone the mate that they deserve, and not necessarily the one that they think are the one that they want!  Perhaps it is better to let genuine values and truth be the basis of true happiness for a relationship be built upon, because i don't think there is a Taoist God of Fair Divorce!  (except maybe the tough and non-bribery accepting Justice Bao -- you need to go to Paya Lebar Road for that, so good luck trying to appeal to him with bribes of gold joss paper! üòÇüòÇüòÇüòâ)  Back to Yueh Hai Ching Temple, The Left shrine is dedicated to Mah Zhu, Patron Goddess of Fisherfolk and Sailors, and Early Straits Chinese Migrants would pray for aid in their businesses and sea expeditions. Do check for her holy days and feasts days to experience the pomp and circumstance of taoist celebrations.  On the Right is Heavenly King of the Cardinal North XuanTianDaDi, also a prominent Deity of the North to surpress calamities, even dark forces ( provided you are not guilty or at fault for your own predicament!), Both are given equal stature hence the shrines and gates.  There is much of straits chinese  temple culture to research, and sadly Google doesn't allow me space to go into details!  But do go and pay attention to details, the temple custodians are helpful, and please tip them if you ask for a tour and also intersession with Yueh Lao!

caption: It was our second time at Summerhouse and it didn't disappoint! Beautiful and romantic ambience as always. It wasn't too crowded on the Saturday evening we visited, and so the wonderful staff were able to spend more time with every table.  Really appreciated the food and wine recommendations given by our server, and the sous chef Neville who come out and personally explained some of the dishes to us. Amazing that they had such great produce from Australia and their own gardens (you can go around the back and walk through the greenery, try to spot some of the food you ate)!  Food was great, wine pairings awesome, and really enjoyed our time there. 5/5 will come back again soon!

The food is exceptional. Ingredients are fresh and tasty, I like their egg. Their idea of atas kaya toast is quite interesting, it‚Äôs actually a bread roll stuffed with kaya toast and butter with a sous vide egg. We didn‚Äôt get to enjoy the garden much as it‚Äôs raining. caption: I came here for dinner.  Food is good, but very pricy.  Definitely good for private and more intimate meals if you book the garden dome. There are three garden domes.  The taste of the 65‚Äô Florentine egg and truffle was masked by the spinach, but the taste of the spinach was great.  The French onion soup was sweet and thicker which was surprising.  The wagyu striplion was done as a roast and delightful to have with some charring on the sides.  The duck confit was good and not too salty.  The sorbet was refreshing and the jelly lovely to chew on.  Creme br√ªl√©e was good as well.  Good place for more intimate moments.

caption: We had our wedding dinner here. The biggest decisive factor for us, which we are the happiest about, was Aska - the main man who oversaw everything! From day one, he made me and my then-fiancee feel welcome to The Summerhouse and reassured us that everything would go smoothly. On the day itself, he was able to foresee our needs, was on the ball with everything, and well-organised. All the way from ROM to the end of the dinner, we were well taken care of. We would not have been able to do any of it without him! Sara, the event planner who liaised with us, was also a great help.  We loved the wedding so much. The ambience was perfect - intimate and cosy, and the food was delicious. Our guests also enjoyed themselves tremendously. Big thanks to everyone for everything!

Will recommend it to couples.

name: The Summerhouse
opening_hours: Wednesday, 8 am to 11 pm; Thursday, 8 am to 11 pm; Friday, 8 am to 12 am; Saturday, 8 am to 12 am; Sunday, 8 am to 11 pm; Monday, 8 am to 11 pm; Tuesday, 8 am to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Ambience: 5/5 Food: 2/5 (the REALLY SALTY duck leg confit is quite horrible imo, and it tainted our experience) Service: 4/5  Me and my partner made a reservation here on 28 Jan, 7pm to celebrate our anniversary. I will write a very honest review about our experience here. The area where we were sitted was v nice, beside a beautifully decorated wall of plants. I think these 'nicer' seats are given to ppl who are celebrating special occasions. I appreciate the service crew's effort to sit us there. We ordered the 'communal dining' course meal. There were some good courses and several hit and misses, with ONE VERY TERRIBLE MISS. We especially enjoyed the rye bread with home made butter, and the grilled prawns. The avocado truffle ikura with quinoa crackers was interesting, something new to our taste buds. The starters were pretty solid, so they did build up our anticipation for the mains, only for us to be sorely disappointed. When the duck leg confits were served, we were pretty pumped as they looked visually pleasing. The meat looked tender, and they fell off the bones easily. However, lo and behold, they were REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY!! SALTY!!!!! I am someone who eats salty food, and believe me when I say this is really freaking salty, on another level already. On par with or even possibly surpassing the saltiness of salted egg white. I tried 2 more bites, but it was overwhelmingly salty, so I summoned the courage to bring up the matter to the service crew. I have never complained about food to any service crew before, but this duck confit was the first time I felt a need to. It felt like ingesting spoons of salt with every bite. What I got from the service crew was that 'french food is supposed to be salty'. I attempted to ask for a change in the course meal, but it did not look like it was going to happen as the manager was rather adamant that the food is supposed to be salty, although I am still not convinced it should be THIS salty. The manager offered us more onion sauce to neutralise the saltiness...and because we did not want to make things difficult, despite the really no go duck confit in our opinion, we just suck thumb and eat lor. I tried my best to eat as much as I could cus it's not cheap... So, ORDER AT YOUR DISCRETION... Order only if you know you can eat a whole duck leg size of salted egg white... The elderflower sorbet is really nice tho, IT WAS THE SAVING GRACE. And at last, the crew gave us an on the house red velvet cheesecake to celebrate our anniversary, and that also helped to make the evening a little better, and we do appreciate the effort.  It was not a bad experience overall, bcus it was rather funny trying to finish eating sth so... salty. LOL.
name: The Summerhouse
opening_hours: Wednesday, 8 am to 11 pm; Thursday, 8 am to 11 pm; Friday, 8 am to 12 am; Saturday, 8 am to 12 am; Sunday, 8 am to 11 pm; Monday, 8 am to 11 pm; Tuesday, 8 am to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: It was my first visit to this lovely cosy place tucked away in the quiet (or maybe not so quiet since it's almost at the doorstep of Seletar Airport) estate of Seletar Aerospace Park in the northeastern part of Singapore. It might be a little out of the way for some though.  I had a hot caramel latte (which is kind of like my must-have drink no matter where I dine at) that came with "love"‚Äîsimple latte art. For the mains, I had soft-shell chilli crab linguine, which turned out to be an absolute delight. If you're up for it, take each spoonful with a bite of the chilli padi. It could be a little too spicy for folks who don't really eat spicy food.  We do, however, have a minor complaint. We had some problems making payment after ordering over their website via a QR code.  If you have time to spare after your meal, do hop over to nearby Hampstead Wetland Park to soak in nature and, after that, head up to Boardwalk@Seletar where you can see the airport runway dotted with small airplanes on the perimeter tracks. You may also catch an airplane or two taking off or landing. As you walk up Hyde Park Gate, you will see several large abandoned, recently or long ago, colonial bungalows, which make for an interesting backdrop for those 'gram shots.  In all, I'd recommend this place for its chill vibes.

caption: Nice place to chill with friends. Food was better than expected. We were expecting bar food but turned out much better. Interesting cocktail. Service was prompt. We were told that we only have 2 hours to drink n dine but we stayed for nearly 3 hours without any problem.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Outstanding service, despite being busy. We were shown to our table promptly but weren't hurried for the duration. A wonderful opportunity to relax and enjoy the delectable cocktail selection!  For anyone unfamiliar, the view of the Marina is spectacular. The music is perfect for the venue.  Only challenge is navigating the national gallery to get there - but worth getting lost for!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Great view and fun cocktails.  We ordered a few different types, Singapore sling, moves like jigger, monochrome and woks that smell.  All unique. The woks that smell tasted exactly like woodfire smoke, the moves like jigger came out on a bed of dry ice so was fun to watch steam. Monochrome was probably our least favourite but oddly tasted like paper and graphite.  Good to come for a cocktail - food was average - come for drinks, dine elsewhere
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Rated as one of the Top bars in Asia, Smoke and mirrors lives up to the hype. The views from top are gorgeous, panning a picturesque view of Marina Bay. The cocktail menu is quirky, with flavors and stories of Singapore weaved in, priced at the higher side of $25 and upwards (which is pretty standard for top bars in Singapore.) An ideal date night place, reservations are mandatory unless you want to chance a walk-in and might get lucky. Food menu is limited to snacky bar food, good for a light nibble with drinks. Staff is polite and friendly and also offered us a birthday drink which was a super sweet gesture. It's a star short in review because while the vibe and view is spot on, cocktails weren't exceptional. Many other speakeasy do a better job, and would have expected a bit more from this place. Still highly recommended to visit and experience.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: My second time at Smoke & Mirrors. Nothing can beat its view - it has the much coveted front row Marina Bay Sands view, and cityscape on both Raffles Place and City Hall areas. Really wonderful view and perfect if you are a views person.  Drinks were quite decent too. Their interesting menu links each of their cocktails with an art piece. You can scan the QR code on the menu to check out the art that inspires your cocktail. Quite a cool experience and connects the guests with the national gallery just downstairs.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Loved the place .. love the vibe ..Excellent place if u want to celebrate any special occasion. Try and get outside sitting tables if u like sitting outdoor,  view is beautiful üòç Drinks were superb , we tried mostly all of them and all were excellent.! Food wise they are just serving small menu and it‚Äôs good enough to enjoy with drinks . Would definitely recommend this place üëç
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Came here twice & I really do enjoy their drinks. Only down side is that if you're sitting outside & there's no breeze... Be prepared to sweat. If you're seated inside, some areas don't really get any aircon at all so it can get stuffy. Service & drinks are good, but not super comfortable when you're sweating.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Fabulous roof top view of the Padang and MBS is worth it. Good cocktails and decent bar bites with a few vegetarian options. Great service, and we received complimentary cocktails for our anniversary celebration.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: It was evening. Sun has set. But alas it was still too hot regardless of outdoor or indoor seating. Staff forgot our order and returned to ask for it again. Food took a while to arrive. Cocktails are overpriced. View is over rated.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Very nice cocktail bar. We had a bit of a hard time finding it, but once we were there we enjoyed our time there very much. Our waiter was very kind and attentive, always ready to give recommendations, which I appreciated. Cocktails were great, view is nice.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Smoke and mirrors has been on my list for a while. While the atmosphere and service were great, I was disappointed with one of the cocktails I ordered. I ordered one of their signature cocktail Beyond The Canyon, but it tasted really bad. There was nothing other than a sour taste, and I couldn't taste any alcohol at all. I even asked my friend to try it, and they agreed that there was no alcohol taste at all. It felt like the alcohol was forgotten to add in, making it the worst drink I've ever had. I was really looking forward to trying this cocktail, but unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations. I hope the bar can improve the quality of their cocktails in the future
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Loved the drinks. Food, so-so. Service was great! But didn't like where we were seated even if we reserved a table cos we were in a corner.. And just barely 2 feet behind me was a pipe and a waiter station
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Amazing views, great vibes and very creative and fun drinks that are inspired by artworks of the national Singapore gallery. Definitely recommend!!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Great view of Padang and Downtown skyline, especially MBS! Fantastic place to chill out after work. Sit down and relax with Singapore Sling and some finger food. Relaxing place nice ambiance !
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Highly recommend! Great views, delicious and interesting drinks, and good service. We did not reserve and was seated in the indoors lounge area around 5:45 pm on a Sunday, but after we ordered, we were offered a table on the terrace because it was free until 7 pm, which was very appreciated. Not super crowded on a Sunday night and overall the vibe was very chill.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Delicious & Innovative Cocktails paired with a Great View.  We came here without reservation, but it was no issue. They have ‚Äúoutdoor‚Äù and ‚Äúindoor‚Äù area, but really it‚Äôs an open-aired venue. Definitely a common date-night spot or spot for several friends to gather for a good drink. We‚Äôre big cocktail people and we were impressed. If you have a particular style, they‚Äôll point you in the right direction of what will suit your fancy. The menu is also one of those that directs you towards particular styles (boldness, flavor, etc.). Some interesting concepts embedded in their drinks as well. We really liked the tea-inspired cocktail that came as a set of two and only utilized Japanese liquor - pretty unique. Service was superb and we wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return when we come back to Singapore.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: One of the best cocktail experiences I've had was at a rooftop bar overlooking the city skyline. Wee was a true mixologist, carefully crafting each drink with precision and care
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Sickening view of Marina Bay Sands and the bartenders have a sense of humour and are adorable! Stunning cocktails, nothing else to say! I had a great time there ü•á ‚Ä¶
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Bartenders are so friendly and kind. They are so professional and do great performance when they make the menu. It feels like art not just cocktail. Night view of this bar is so amazing and good to take pictures. I had Moves like Jigger.  Coconut like cup is so interesting and it has its own performance when bartenders make it. Let's enjoy it!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Amazing view of MBS, the bay, and the financial district. Drinks were more than just drinks - they were art. Servers were top notch
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: recommended by my friend whose cousin works there as a bartender. weesiong was very talented, the drinks that he made were super good. he understands the customer preference and recommends the correct drinks. the place was super good to chill. the atmosphere was good with singapore signature view, CBD and MBS.  food there was good too. ordered their cod fish tacos and quesadilla with pulled pork.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: One of the best bars in Singapore. Amazing location. Menu is great. Shoutout to Joshua for being the most amazing bartender. The cocktails he recommended and made for us were too good. Dont miss out on a pink guava based cocktail if you want to have a truly tropical experience. Views are to die for. Highly recommend this place. Thanks Joshua for making it even more special for us.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: If you want a good rooftop bar with a really good view I REALLY RECOMMEND THIS ONE!! We were on more rooftop bars and this was the best one. The service was super friendly and the view just wow! You should reserve before, and of course the prices are a little bit higher but I think on all rooftop bars! Really creative cocktails!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Smoke and Mirrors, National Gallery: Perched at 60th spot of the Top 50 Asia bars, Smoke and Mirrors is still a crowd favourite for the grandiose  panoramic sweeping view of Marina Bay Sands. What more of the last day of the Night to Light festival - which lights up the entire Padang view. Smoke and Mirrors has that curvy elegant silver bar that is reminiscent of Anish Kapoor‚Äôs Cloud Gate in windy Chicago. If you want the coveted front row seats to a view, book in advance. Wok‚Äôs That Smell, cheekily named is a modern take on wok staples such as fried hor fun sitting on a coaster that shields llapcheog (Chinese sausage) smoke. The whole experience is fun. Although the hor fun could be seasoned with seaweed or seasonings for more of an umami taste. Dry January cocktail dark and spicy tastes straight up like ginger ale but looks good with the sultry lighting. Apart from the strange crowd comprising mostly tourists, this is one classy bar that ticks all the right boxes. #eatstylishtravelstylish
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Great views from this place in the evening, bartenders were fantastic. Drinks are expensive‚Ä¶ but it should be expected for this venue class!!!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: It was a really beautiful bar, with amazing view of Marina Bay. Set on top of the national gallery in the civic district, do try to place reservation for the outdoor seats. Do note there is no fan/ air conditioning, so dress accordingly.  The drinks were delightful. Cha cha duet was my first poison of choice - a delightful fruity, tea infused cocktails which turned into three different drinks: recommended for those who like sweet and sour drinks. It was super smooth and went down very easily - highly recommended if you're up for something experimental.  Second drink was monkey god: a rye whiskey based cocktail with a sweet depiction of a yin and yang on a rice sheet, placed on top of the drink. It was refreshing and smooth drink, highly recommended.  Service team was delightful and attentive, regularly checking and topping up our water.  One advice: don't order the fries, the portion was really small :(
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Amazing service & food & drinks!! the view is gorgeous. Been here multiple times. I always hosts my guests from overseas here because I know Smoke & Mirrors won‚Äôt disappoint. Shoutout to Xue Li for always getting us a good table! Will be back soon.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Definitely recommend Wok's That Smell.  You will taste a strong smokey (wokhei) taste at first, followed by a deep sweet and the back of your tongue and finished with a light spiciness lingered at the back of the throat.  However the place is a little warm and this is not a cheap place.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: This place has everything:  Spectacular view (10 out of 10) Great food!! (9 out of 10) Thoughtfully curated cocktails (100 out of 10!)  But what made our visit here extra special was the accommating staff members and bartenders. (1000 out of 10!!) Everyone is so nice and a special shout-out to those who accommodated us and made us feel welcome: JV, Kat, Wei Ling and Zen.  I will definitely be back simply for that last reason but everything else is a nice bonus.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Located on the roof of marina l gallery of Singapore, one of the best speakeasy rooftop bars in Singapore offering breathtaking views of the Singapore city skyline. Cocktail menu is very well curated, each drink reciped after an art exhibition with a little bit of history and rationale behind the ingredients chosen, thank you for making the effort to represent the gallery with your menu!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Bought the bottled cocktails for a gift and they were perfect. They managed to personalised them well and im sure my boss will love them. After service was really professional too. Thank you for the awesome design.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: After at horrible dinner 2 levels down we needed a bit of cheering up so went to smoke and mirrors for some drinks. The staff was super friendly and attentive. Nice view of the Marina and very good cocktails, i had 1 my Partner 2 they were all great. Very chilled and relaxed atmosphere , even with background music we could have a relaxed conversation. Highly recommended.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Cool spot for creative cocktails and a chill night. The cocktails were great, with an artsy flair. View was nice looking over the field at the city and Marina Bay. Drinks are a bit steep on cost...but somewhat expected for rooftop bars. Food was good...but I would say it is more of a drink spot then dinner spot. I would definitely go back.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Food menu is a bit limited, service is correct. Go there for the stunning view. Cocktails are fancy, even though the presentation is quite plain. All in all it lacks a bit of something to make it the unforgettable experience I was expecting
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: I ordered a birthday gift for my friend in Singapore and the service was amazing. The gift was elegantly packed and the message was beautifully handwritten. I‚Äôm so glad that I stumbled upon the website when I was searching for the perfect gift. Can‚Äôt wait to try the cocktails when I visit in person.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: You can see beautiful scenery! The cocktail is not bad but not good
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Amazing cocktails options Stupendous views from the balcony  A bit pricey but it‚Äôs totally worth for his or her special day!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Really beautiful view of singapore skyline, flyer and esplanade. Drinks were good, very unique experience
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: We messaged quite late yesterday afternoon via Whatsapp & were promptly & pleasantly surprised to receive a reply accepting a last minute booking. We could not have been happier to bring our overseas visitors to experience the unique views & incredible cocktail options on offer at Smoke & Mirrors. Enjoying these as the sun set & the energetic cityscape lit up was magical last night. Thank you to the welcoming waitstaff & cocktail creators for leveling up the ambiance and views we shared with our guests on their final night in Singapore.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: This was a nice setting for drinks on the fourth floor overlooking the bay. The Singapore sling and braised beef with potatoes were great.  It was our honeymoon so the host gave us some champagne on the house. It was a good experience and the hostess was great.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: If I could leave 10 stars I would! this is by far one of the best bars in town. great cocktails menu that gets updated frequently, top ingredients, the team is awesome super welcoming knowledgeable &  fun. no works for the ambience & the view...top marks! highly recommended bar for a great experience. 10/10 & high five for a job well done! thank you
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: I've been to S&M a couple of times (PS VIEW IS AMAZING), and this time decided to order their mocktails + cocktail for home delivery for a friend's bachelor night. The labels on the mocktails can be customized, and they delivered them right on point. Eileen checked in with me after delivery and I mentioned that there was a bit of spillage (which might have been due to delivery which is not their fault). I did not expect it at all, but she offered to replace the ones that had spillage issues and I received the replacements promptly. The team really went above and beyond to ensure that they excel in what they do. Thank you for making my night; it's been a while since I've visited a place with such ethos. Thank you, Eileen and Team, and I highly recommend this place for its drinks, view, and service.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Just wow! We visited three of the best Bars in Singapur that day and this was my favorite one!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Great ambience and view! Incredibly imaginative and creatively put together cocktail menu that reflected the art work at the galleries. Definitely a must-visit!  Marketing manager - Vanessa Amy Rex sold the place so well and was a great help prior to my visit to the bar as she assisted me with information on the place and reservation details as well.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: The atmosphere was nice, view great but the food was bad!  The tempura was very bitter (so much so that I actually didnt finish it), pizza was crispy   but tasted average, and no one pays $12 for avocado as a side!  Also, I asked 2 different wait staff for a fork, both acknowledged but neither brought it so I had to get up and get it myself from the bar. Moreover, one of the staff I asked was the floor manager.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Fantastic bar with wonderful atmosphere, outstanding drinks and view! A great spot to visit when in Singapore!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Fantastic location for a great evening in Singapore. The drinks were as special as the location - the menu design itself was well done with further information per drink and each one having it's own twist (e.g. a magic trick being performed by the waiter once the drink is served). We additionally ordered food which fit the overall concept of the bar well (not too heavy food, not too light). The view speaks for itself and also the inside design of the bar was well done. Everything being topped up by the great choice of music playlist (70s to 90s) made our evening fabulous.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Love the cocktails here, as each is inspired by an art piece or artist found in the National Gallery.  The service here is impeccable and would be returning again and again!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Was really disappointed when we arrived at pur appointment, the view was blocked by the setting up of the upcoming Singapore National Day.  The restaurant did not give any warnings of this and the whole ambience was nothing of what we have read.  On top.of that, we paid absurd high prices for our cocktails.which cist on average $32 each.  Crazy!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Awesome service from the bar manager (for her prompt responses and swift action), as well as the waiting/bar staff ‚Äî all who served last night, 6 Mar (MON). Kudos to the team! My tourist friends and guests were thoroughly impressed ‚Äî and will be bringing their respective superiors to visit this place soon, too. Highly recommended.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Nice place to good views when sitting outdoors. Has a very good collection of whisky, gin and rum for the ones who prefer to try out different liquors. Decent food options as well. Would recommend :)
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Beautiful bar serving special cocktails with a beautiful view of the city
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: I would like to give 5 star for the view and the service but the outdoor sitting can get really hot considering the weather in Singapore. Also the vegetation food we ordered was very average nothing that great but the cocktails were good and worth trying.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: A pretty nice view, though not very high up. Experience marred by unbelievably arrogant staff. Food does not arrive, and then they claim was never ordered, effectively accusing us of lying! When eventually arrives, not so great. There are some other restaurants nearby with similar view that do not do such aggressive marketing, and probably a better bet. NB note the faux apology in their response below and continued denial.

caption: Walk-in as the booking need deposit. For balcony seating there will be minimum spend for 50sgd per pax. Without any much hassle, settled down at indoor couch & watched the busy bartenders
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Fantastic view. Really enjoy the drink and place.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Here for the view. We experienced someone proposing on the sky.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: This is unquestionably the best view of Singapore, hands down, so book an outdoor table for 7:00 pm (they only take online reservations 2 weeks in advance) and enjoy your view, cocktails and bar bites as the sun sets. you have the table for 2 hours.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: I ordered a gift from Smoke and Mirrors- the classic cocktails and the large Hanky Panky. They were great ! Delivered on time, the packaging was beautiful! And they were able to print a message on the label though I ordered last minute for delivery the next day ! I cannot recommend them enough !

caption: A great tourist experience - excellent cocktails with an unforgettable panoramic aspect over Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore skyline

caption: Fantastic experience! Wonderful, unique cocktails with the stunning backdrop of the glittering city. Excellent service too!
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Good view... Bad cocktails, waiters ignore you, dirty tables. Try another rooftop bar if you want the view.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: Atmosphere: 5 star, Night view: 5 star, Staff & Service: 4 star, Drinks: 2.5 star, expensive but average taste Food: 0 star, worst food ever, it's better to eat dinner before you visit.
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: A night out in Singapore on a Friday night. Post a Chopin concert in Victoria Hall off for drinks to Smoke and Mirrors. No one queueing, about half empty, and guests just leaving and it is 2230 hours. One waitress, claiming to be the manager, no name tag, just a tattoo, suggesting the bar area is closed and all seats reserved. How disappointing. PS: another now kind staff member explained that they only have one bar tender on duty manning the bar on a Friday night. Seems the way forward is home entertainment...
name: Smoke & Mirrors

caption: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands left me utterly impressed with its opulent ambiance and an unparalleled shopping experience. As I wandered through the luxurious halls, I was enamored by the world-class selection of high-end fashion boutiques, jewelry stores, and designer brands. The glistening storefronts and elegant interiors create a sophisticated atmosphere, making shopping here a truly indulgent affair. The canal running through the mall adds a unique touch, offering the chance to enjoy a leisurely boat ride amidst the exquisite architecture. With its extensive array of dining options, from fine dining to casual eateries, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands is the epitome of luxury shopping and dining in the heart of Singapore.
name: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Very bright mall with very good natural lighting. Most stores here are high end stores like Gucci and Chanel, mostly catered to tourist. Normal peasants won‚Äôt be able to afford anything here like me. Be prepared to spend a fortune here. The staffs here are very friendly and well trained, come here if you want to see how customer service should be.
name: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

caption: I would give this shopping center a 5-star review.  The mall offers an impressive selection of stores, ranging from popular high street brands such as Zara to luxury brands such as Chanel. The Apple Store is also a popular attraction for tech-savvy shoppers.  The mall's beautiful cafes and clean, spotless environment create a pleasant shopping experience. With a wide range of dining options available, shoppers can take a break and indulge in some delicious food and drinks.  Overall, The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands is a must-visit destination for anyone visiting Singapore. The mall's impressive selection of stores, beautiful cafes, and spotless environment make it an exceptional shopping experience. I hope that others will have the opportunity to visit and enjoy it as much as I did. :)
name: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

caption: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a multi-storey shopping mall attached to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It gives a grand feel with many luxurious and international shops within. There are many eateries inside and on the skirts of the shopping mall. There is also a Marina Bay Walking and Running trial outside the shopping mall. Where the weather permits, it will definitely be a nice walk and/or run outdoors.
name: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 10 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 10 pm; Friday, 10 am to 10 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 10 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 10 pm; Monday, 10 am to 10 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 10 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Most Beautiful Mall in Singapore  This is a mall that certainly focuses on visitor experience and makes you want to repeatedly return to.  It has so many things to offer other than high end shopping and food. The Rain Occulus water fountain, boat rides within the mall, digital light art, a view of the Singapore skyline, a beautiful waterfront, laser shows at night, huge walking spaces both inside and outside the mall, the Art Science Museum next door, a roof terrace, connecting bridges to the Gardens by the Bay, glass roofs that give you that infinity feeling etc.  For food it has a beautiful food court (it's relatively cheap to other food options but certainly not at normal food court prices but still very affordable). Numerous Michelin Star restaurants as well as high end Omakase dining options are available for the more discerning customer.  There are some very interesting shops that are on the water that are part of the mall. Most of the shopping is high end except for the pharmacies.  There is a lot of parking available but it can be very expensive and crowded especially on days when there are conventions going on. Better to take the train to Bayfront MRT right at the mall on those days. The car parks are well-lit and easy to manoeuvre though  Overall, this is an excellent mall that keeps improving and re-inventing itself. Will be revisiting over and over again to see what's next.
name: The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands

caption: Went there on my son‚Äôs school field trip and it was a fun experience! We got to feed the goats and my son was so excited. The uncle who explained about the goat facts also very informative. There‚Äôs a mini shop at the entrance to buy some snacks, the goat milks and also the hay to feed the goats.  This is a great for kids‚Äô educational / family activity üòä
name: Hay Dairies Pte Ltd (Goat Farm)
opening_hours: Wednesday, 9 am to 4 pm; Thursday, 9 am to 4 pm; Friday, 9 am to 4 pm; Saturday, 9 am to 4 pm; Sunday, 9 am to 4 pm; Monday, 9 am to 4 pm; Tuesday, Closed. Hide open hours for the week

caption: I brought a group of preschoolers to Hay Dairies during the March School Holidays and it was also my first trip. I‚Äôd like to say, the place exceeded my expectations; it was relatively clean and well maintained. The smell was bearable and understandable (it‚Äôs an animal farm after all), and the children did not seemed bothered by the smell too. It was pretty crowded with parents bringing in their children, but the service we received were great. Our guide brought us around and explained the process of milking to the children. We also had ample time to feed the children (imagine allowing 20 children to feed the goats individually). The price range was reasonable and we also got to bring home some goat‚Äôs milk. It‚Äôs not easy upkeeping a goat‚Äôs farm and I could tell that the goats were pretty healthy and well maintained. Please keep up the good work so that more people can come and learn more about goats, especially the younger ones!
name: Hay Dairies Pte Ltd (Goat Farm)
opening_hours: Wednesday, 9 am to 4 pm; Thursday, 9 am to 4 pm; Friday, 9 am to 4 pm; Saturday, 9 am to 4 pm; Sunday, 9 am to 4 pm; Monday, 9 am to 4 pm; Tuesday, Closed. Hide open hours for the week

caption: I have come here a few times with my kids and till today, they always enjoy the experience of feeding the goats.  This is a good place to kick off the morning of farm visits, because activities here start at 9am. As always, we would feed the goats, see them get milked. Today, we caught sight of goats standing on their hind legs. End off the visit by washing up first, then try the chocolate goat milk which is really good.  I visited in early Jun 2023. Visitors might want to check where the farm is before heading there, because the farm is relocating.
name: Hay Dairies Pte Ltd (Goat Farm)
opening_hours: Wednesday, 9 am to 4 pm; Thursday, 9 am to 4 pm; Friday, 9 am to 4 pm; Saturday, 9 am to 4 pm; Sunday, 9 am to 4 pm; Monday, 9 am to 4 pm; Tuesday, Closed. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Hay Dairies Pte Ltd, commonly known as the Goat Farm, is an intriguing and educational attraction in Singapore. Situated in Lim Chu Kang near the Kranji Countryside, this farm provides visitors with a unique opportunity to immerse themselves in the world of goat farming. Guided tours offer insights into the milking process, allowing visitors to witness the production of fresh goat milk firsthand. The experience is further enriched by the chance to feed and interact with the friendly goats. Hay Dairies' commitment to sustainable farming practices is admirable. Whether you're an animal enthusiast, nature lover, or simply curious about farming, a visit to Hay Dairies promises a fascinating and educational experience.
name: Hay Dairies Pte Ltd (Goat Farm)
opening_hours: Wednesday, 9 am to 4 pm; Thursday, 9 am to 4 pm; Friday, 9 am to 4 pm; Saturday, 9 am to 4 pm; Sunday, 9 am to 4 pm; Monday, 9 am to 4 pm; Tuesday, Closed. Hide open hours for the week

caption: There is a path with a cover that helps prevent getting wet from the rain directly from the city hall station to the gallery. The gallery is huge, I spent three hours inside as they have two blocks with a shared basement level. I will say I am confused about where to start, but I recommend finishing by visiting one block from the top and visiting the basement so you can walk to another block. They have bridges connecting two blocks at some levels, which is a good place to take pictures of the architecture. I admire how they have kids' zone so they can interact with art. The gift shop is fantastic as well as they have items related to the exhibitions, which is what I hope since I have been to different galleries and museums but they don‚Äôt offer a good range of souvenirs.
name: National Gallery Singapore

caption: The National Gallery is a must-visit place in Singapore for both locals and tourists alike! The architecture is stunning, and the space is just so beautifully designed. There's history, art, architecture, and lots of wonderful programs for children! It was busy today when we visited, but it never felt uncomfortable. There are lots of staff positioned throughout the gallery, and they are ever ready to assist visitors with anything. The National Gallery also has quite a few restaurants. Some with Michelin stars. If you're visiting Singapore and strapped for time, I would recommend trying to dine at Voliolet Oon's restaurant there to have a taste of some local Peranakan fare. They have an excellent high tea.
