caption: My visit to the National Gallery of Singapore was an enriching and captivating experience. This architectural masterpiece houses an impressive collection of artwork that celebrates Singaporean and Southeast Asian artistry and culture.  From the moment I stepped into the gallery, I was greeted by a vibrant and inviting atmosphere. The carefully curated exhibitions showcased a diverse range of artistic expressions, spanning various mediums and styles. The thoughtfully arranged displays allowed me to immerse myself in the rich tapestry of Singapore's artistic heritage.  One of the highlights of the National Gallery was the opportunity to view iconic works by renowned Singaporean artists, as well as discover emerging talents. The gallery's commitment to supporting local artists and promoting their works was evident throughout the exhibitions. It was inspiring to witness the creative journey of Singaporean artists and gain a deeper appreciation for their contributions to the art world.  The National Gallery's emphasis on interactive experiences added an extra layer of engagement. The guided tours and audio guides provided insightful narratives and historical context, allowing me to better understand the significance and meaning behind each artwork. The interactive installations and multimedia presentations created a dynamic and immersive environment, making my visit a truly interactive and educational one.  The National Gallery's commitment to accessibility was commendable. The gallery spaces were designed to accommodate visitors of all ages and abilities. The presence of ramps, elevators, and clear signages made navigation seamless, ensuring that everyone could enjoy and appreciate the exhibitions. The gallery also offers a range of educational programs and workshops, catering to diverse interests and fostering a love for art among the younger generation.  The National Gallery's location in the heart of Singapore's civic district added to its appeal. Its proximity to other cultural landmarks such as the Padang, the Asian Civilisations Museum, and the Merlion Park allowed me to immerse myself in a full day of cultural exploration. The nearby cafes and restaurants provided a perfect opportunity to relax and reflect on the inspiring artworks I had encountered.  The National Gallery of Singapore is a treasure trove of artistic expression that every young Singaporean should explore. From its diverse collection to its interactive experiences and commitment to accessibility, the gallery offers an enriching journey that celebrates the beauty and creativity of Singaporean and Southeast Asian art. Whether you're an art enthusiast or simply curious about our cultural heritage, the National Gallery promises an experience that will broaden your horizons and ignite your passion for art.
name: National Gallery Singapore

caption: Popped in to visit on the 18th of May to see what was going on in the gallery. By sheer chance it happened to be International Museum Day and the exhibits were free entry! Very lucky indeed.  The paintings and artworks were incredibly thought provoking and it brought in a sense of Singaporean culture I hadn‚Äôt seen yet on my trip: vulnerability, political struggle and hardship were all very much present in the exhibitions.  One of the most interesting exhibits came from the video art exhibit which showed off some of the art history from the VHS era. The art piece with the TV‚Äôs and the faces was particularly disturbing, yet thought provoking nonetheless.  Overall, great experience!

It is on till November 2023. Upon entry, you‚Äôd receive a ‚Äúboarding pass‚Äù that can be scanned at certain installations which activates bonus content. Super cute and i love it!  Also saw the Story Of The Forest exhibit at the Glass Rotunda and it was beautiful. caption: Turn right after the entrance, and you will be guided to admission. I spent 2-3 hours inside the museum. Recommend starting at level 1, where they start explaining how people live in Singapore in the old days and move yourself to level 2 for the latest history. There are a few galleries not related to historical knowledge, such as the glass rotunda and a special gallery that give a broad understanding of how Singapore travel, eat, and where tourist stay and have entertainment. The gallery of Semangat Yang Baru has an interactive bracket that allows you to answer questions and get a test result of what kind of champion you are, which is located in the basement level with the special gallery.
name: National Museum of Singapore
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Friday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Monday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 6:30 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: This is an amazing museum all about Singapore from pre-colonial time through the eras of the colonial powers and finally to the present day. I can see the enthusiasm in which the curators lovingly put together the exhibits. The information is excellent, especially in the use of personal testimonies through audio recordings and videos. The Singapore History Gallery has some very high quality exhibits and a fantastic mock up of the quarterdeck of a ship. My personal favourite section was the Forest video exhibition. It really gives you an appreciation of how hard life was back then and just how good life is in Singapore. I was only planning for 3 hours here, but ended up for 5. This museum is one of the best things to see in Singapore.

Do stop by Supermama (gift shop) to pick up some memorabilia of the city, lots of coffee table books and modern quirky design souvenirs worthy as gifts or to keep for a long time. caption: My family and I visited the National Museum of Singapore during Chinese New Year and we were delighted to catch The Doraemon Exhibition Singapore 2022. The exhibition was a treat for both kids and adults alike, featuring interactive displays, life-sized installations and a fascinating history of the beloved character. There were also lots of photo opportunities and a wide range of merchandise available for purchase.  The National Museum of Singapore itself is a beautiful and well-maintained building, with spacious galleries and helpful staff. Overall, our experience at the National Museum of Singapore was both enjoyable and educational. It's definitely a must-visit destination for families looking for a fun and enriching day out.

name: National Museum of Singapore
opening_hours: Wednesday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Thursday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Friday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Saturday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Sunday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Monday, 10 am to 6:30 pm; Tuesday, 10 am to 6:30 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Visiting the National Museum is an enriching and captivating experience that offers a deep dive into the rich history, culture, and art of a country. As I stepped through the grand entrance, I was immediately greeted by a sense of awe and anticipation. The museum's majestic architecture and well-curated exhibits created an ambience that was both inspiring and educational.  Upon entering the museum, I was greeted by friendly staff members who provided me with a map and highlighted the must-see exhibits. The museum's layout was thoughtfully designed, guiding visitors through various sections and periods, allowing for a comprehensive exploration of the nation's heritage.  As I walked through the exhibits, I was surrounded by a treasure trove of artefacts, artworks, and historical displays. Each exhibit was meticulously arranged and accompanied by informative signage, providing context and insights into the significance of each piece. From ancient artefacts to contemporary artworks, the museum showcased the diverse aspects of the nation's culture and history.  One of the highlights of my visit was the interactive exhibits. These immersive displays utilized technology and multimedia elements to engage visitors on a deeper level.  These interactive elements brought history to life and allowed me to have a more engaging and memorable experience. Especially love the one at the Glass Rotunda!  The national museum also featured temporary exhibitions that showcased specific themes or artists. These rotating exhibits added an element of excitement and ensured that there was always something new to discover with each visit. It was fascinating to see how the museum adapted and showcased different aspects of the nation's culture and art scene through these special exhibits..  As I reached the end of my visit, I couldn't help but feel a profound sense of appreciation and pride for the nation's history and cultural heritage. The national museum had successfully transported me through time, offering a glimpse into the past and a better understanding of the present.  Overall, my experience at the national museum was unforgettable. It provided a captivating journey through the nation's history, culture, and art, leaving me with a deeper appreciation for the diverse tapestry of the country's heritage. I left the museum with a renewed sense of curiosity and a desire to continue exploring and learning about the nation's rich cultural legacy.

caption: We were recommended to visit by a local grab driver and I‚Äôm so glad we did! It‚Äôs one thing to visit a place and go to all the most eye catching sights and it‚Äôs another to actually learn their history.  This place is a great mix of both, with nice architecture and interactive exhibits about the story of Singapore. I particularly enjoyed listening to the young girl who went to the early schools in Singapore and learning about the societal expectations of the time. It was also eye-opening hearing and reading the stories of survival during Japanese rule.  I feel privileged to be able to visit and learn so much. üòÑ

caption: Excellent destination for anyone interested in exploring the history and cultural heritage of this fascinating country!  The timeline-based tour through history is a great way to learn about and experience the progression of Singaporean culture over the centuries, and the exhibits on historical figures of importance really bring that history to life.  The museum explores the many different cultures and traditions that have shaped Singaporean society, from Malay and Chinese to Indian and European. The exhibits are beautifully curated and designed, with plenty of interactive displays and multimedia elements that help bring the history to life.  I loved the focus on racial unity that runs throughout the museum. It's clear that a lot of thought has gone into ensuring that visitors come away with a deep appreciation for the importance of diversity in Singaporean society.

caption: Must say that our local museums are improving all the time, and really appreciate the free entry for locals/PR, which is a rarity in our society.  Although the main war/history exhibit was educational and intriguing, it would have been great to add abit more dramatic music/stronger lighting, with personal emotional stories, for a greater story telling - you would know if you have visited the 9/11 one in NYC.  Nevertheless, nicely put together and well put together layouts, great visuals/multimedia, made this visit a pleasantly fulfilling visit, please drop by for a few hours this weekend!

caption: The place is definitely worth a visit. Nice welcoming and easy to get a ticket and start exploring the museum.  We spent so much time on the early history part of Singapore, and we got so tired after nearly 90 minutes. Very little places to sit and rest and dark light makes you consume more energy trying to read the small text. Nevertheless, it was a very good visit and we enjoyed it.  I learned more about Singapore and its past history with Japan. The part it was talking about Japan's invasion/war was very sad and touching. Maybe skip it if you're too sensitive and over emotional. There are many sad stories in there.  There was a group of school students left unattended, the kids were running everywhere and making noise which disturbed us to focus on the content of the museum. This is a negative point on the management for allowing kids unattended and causing so much disturbance around the place.

caption: Security guard - Hafiz (young Malay man with dyed brown hair, in his security uniform suit) from Reachfield security company was the low point of our otherwise wonderful trip to the museum. I was with my 1.5 year old son at the flight info display flipboard and I was supporting my son while he was standing on the dark green parapet and looking at the flipboard in action. Hafiz suddenly walked towards us with pace and aggressiveness and made a very rude hand gesture to shoo us away without even saying anything. I was taken aback by his action and told him he could have asked us nicely and I would get my son off the parapet but he simply shrugged me off and and claimed that the dark green parapet is ‚Äòartifact‚Äô and let off a condescending laughter before walking off. A family trip was disrupted just like that. The rest of the older security personnels that I met in the museum were wonderful and displayed professionalism and empathy  when speaking to us, I cannot say the same of Hafiz. This Hafiz needs to be retrained if he wants to represent both the museum and the security firm. Good luck with that though.
name: National Museum of Singapore

caption: Boarding Gate was interesting but disappointing. I expected it to be about travel to Singapore but it‚Äôs a mish mash of material that‚Äôs linked to a visitors experience through the ages. At $18 for a passing visitor it‚Äôs over priced. Top tip: walk up the steps at the entrance and view the actual boarding gate, then walk into the ticketing area to get a reverse view then walk out, for free. Never sure why visitors are charged more than residents.

caption: Free for students studying in Singaporean Institutes. Ticket costs in general SGD 26 per adult, but we need not pay anything as we showed our NUS e-ID card and student pass.  This is an excellent museum housed in a restored heritage building with connected newly built spaces. You can go through Singapore's journey from early time to contemporary terms. Political history, racial history, etc. are nicely depicted throughout the museum. There are some interesting interactive items. You will be amazed when you go. Took us around 4 hours to have a good glimpse of the total place.  Highly recommended, especially for students and foreigners.

caption: Located in City Hall, CHIJMES derived its iconic status from having an idyllic setting, clocking over 160 years of history, and housing belly rubbing-worthy restaurants. If you find yourself overwhelmed by the multitude of food options, CHIJMES offered food places you can dine at when you‚Äôre in the area.  It is one of Singapore tourist attractions, the complex of convent buildings has a¬†Gothic-style¬†chapel. It was used as a Catholic convent for 132 years, amazing history The chapel, now a multi-purpose hall, The complex has been restored for commercial purposes as a¬†dining,¬†shopping¬†and entertainment centre with ethnic restaurants, shops and a¬†function hall, providing a backdrop for musicals,¬†recitals,¬†theatrical¬†performances and weddings. Overall a wonderful place to go and explore, both daytime and at night.

The snow beef, black cod and the Japanese rice and was excellent but the sushi platter and mixed sashimi is just average. We ordered the mixed Japanese seasonal fruit but the melon and peach isn‚Äôt fully ripe and hence they are not as sweet as i had expected.  Overall this is a place with great ambiance and service but if you are a serious good person, I will not recommend coming here.

caption: Beautiful restaurant! The food is nice too, we ordered all the "safe" recommended dish others reviewed. The black cod was the best, can taste the freshness of the meat and creamy texture of the fish. The Truffle fried rice was okay, truffle never fails to impress then kids. The beef short rib is also worth ordering. And the honey glazed salmon is not bad. All the desserts were pretty and IG worthy. The bonzai was very chocolaty and great - "everything can be eaten including the pot." Lemon yuzu is worth getting too - if you like very sour mixed with very sweet tastes like me. Ordered a mock tail which was pretty but not nice. Oh the tea that came with the set meal is tasteless though, should really get better tea...

caption: We spent SGD $600++ for our dinner. But NOT really impressed with the overall experience. They arranged the counter bar seats for us at 9pm. However, we‚Äôre asking that could we get any other tables once any guests has checked out. They said all tables were fully reserved! But then, at the end of the night, until the restaurant closing.. all those EMPTY Tables just wasted! Could it be all 5-8tables No show? Or the staff just feel it troublesome to change for us? (we‚Äôre having cocktails while waiting for the food to be served) Besides we order quite a few dishes. There was not enough space to serve all the dishes together. So, we couldn‚Äôt enjoy our food at once. And some of the dishes, it‚Äôs already not that hot when it was served. We ordered the recommended dishes, the raw beef A5 but there was no way of plating near to the picture of what we saw in the menu. The plating is ridiculous for the pricing that charged the customer. The taste was bland nothing so special or to shout out. Not worth the money. However the bartender service was okay time to time still bother to check on us, not like the service crew that we tried to get their attention but they just totally ignored, walked passed us blindly or just super enjoyed talking to only specific some of the customers. Hope their management will look in through this matter and solve the issues. The atmosphere, decoration is nice. Unfortunately, the services should be all standardized not just based on the staff personal basis. If their staff gonna act as Premium brand, then they should know their job scopes, their hospitality and work as professionals. On top of that, the food should be improved; Neither salty nor bland. Hopefully to see Koma‚Äôs bright sight again soon.

caption: It was a fantastic dining experience at Koma! The atmosphere is first class with very pleasant service experience.  We were served by Rajani and Sahil. caption: Reservations in this restaurant are difficult to secure. Need to reserve way in advance. We finally got a table for Friday 9.30pm. The minute we stepped into the restaurant everything was a great delightful experience. From the Inari Shrine orange pillars at the entrance, and the majestic oriental decorations at the bar and dining hall, we were in awe. Service was also personalised and prompt. The staff addressed my name personally. The dishes were very well done as you can see from my picture. Except the miso salmon dish, the ginger strips were quite strong, but the miso salmon is absolutely well cooked and delicious. The reception also took nice pictures of us. Only thing is that the toilet is quite poorly maintained. We were given complementary entry to the club next door.

caption: The service staff were great, checked for allergies, split the kids drink in half, ensured presentation and great servicing of food. Fave complimentary desserts for bday dinner! The atmosphere is also fantastic, reservations are difficult need to book in advance. Drinks were awesome too and not too over priced. Similar to what you get elsewhere. Definitely try the sakes.  But frankly that's what you're paying for is that. The food for that price is just average, I think genki sushi does the sashimis and makis better. Some good exceptions were the wagyu tataki, jalapeno ceviche mostly because of the yuzu dressing. The miso eggplant is also good. Lamb chops had no flavour and quite rare. Crispy chicken was not bad though. The mains of black pepper chicken was also average for the price. The desserts were really good though and definitely worth getting some.  Recommended for a special feel good occasion overall experience wise, but go with lower expectations for good Japanese food.

caption: Went on 1st May for lunch. Would not lie that the overall ambience and decorations of the restaurant is aesthetically pleasing to the eyes.. However, when it comes to the food. It's just so-so. Nothing is out of the world. We asked for the waitress for food recommendations and she recommended most of the food that we can see in this review section; Unagi Maki roll, Truffle fried rice, uni carbonara etc etc..  Best part is, when we asked for the drinks recommendation, the waitress recommended drinks based on shape of the cup instead of tasting notes. Usually when we ask for recommendations, people tend to focus on sweetness, sourness, level of alcohol etc. But here, she mentioned that "the cup comes in shape of a bird. if you don't like, you can also take option 3, the cup is in blue color. makes the color of the drink nicer". erm oks. i'm there for a drink and not to admire the cups, Missey.  This establishment is only for show. Will not patronize again

caption: I made a reservation here for my boyfriend and I. (I recommend to make a reservation) Since we were staying in Singapore, I wanted to try it and surprise my BF. I loved everything about it, the staff was so kinda and friendly, and they knew about my allergies everyone that came to our table. So grateful for that. I love the interior, the style, the look, the atmosphere, everything! The food was so amazing, we tried a lot of different meals. And the drinks was so good too. 10/10 if I'm in Singapore again, I'll come here.  I do recommend to try this restaurant, if you're in Singapore. It was so much worth it.

caption: Koma is one of the best Asian fusion restaurants you can find in town. It's not just about the food (which is awesome), but also the overall experience you get when you enter the restaurant till you finish your dining experience. Do note that the food here is pricey, but the presentation and quality of food Koma offers meant that it's still good value for your buck. In addition, you have to be dressed up in order to enter the restaurant, and prior reservations are needed as well.

caption: We had to make reservation one month in advance. We had sashimi platter, maki, unagi and some drinks. The sashimi was very fresh and we could try different types of fishes. When the sashimi platter was served, the staff even checked with me if I wanted to take a video of the dry ice. And, of course I would.  The place was nicely designed which has a Japanese feel. Nice place to take photographs. The space was very big with high ceiling, hence very relaxing. Tables were quite near to each other and we could hear the conversation of the next table.  Beside us were a foreign couple who were ordering beer. He asked the staff for the types of beer they have. The staff refer them to the menu because they have wide variety of beer with descriptions. The man challenged the staff and asked "You don't know what kind of beer you have?" The staff was very professional and explained to him that it would be easier if her refer to the description.  Overall, a nice experience I had even though it's on the pricier side. Wouldn't mind going back again.

caption: Amazing place. Really good customer service. Absolutely enjoyed the hospitality and food. I went here for a birthday celebration. There is plenty of vegetarian options. My favourite was the avocado tempura and the seven treasures maki roll. They were so delicious and smooth. I absolutely enjoyed the feeling of the avocado melting in my mouth. The maki roll was soft and moist and tasted like divine nectar. I enjoyed the smoky flavour of the glazed eggplant which was garnished with a dollop of cream. For the main course, I really loved the tofu hotpot as it was fluffy and tasted wanderlust. Finally, the bonsai chocolate was immaculate and everything including the pit tasted amazing.

caption: This is in MBS itself, one of the levels, just beside Marquee. What is interesting is how a small entrance can lead to such a big interior. The Tori gates give you Japanese vibes. Reservations only here. You need to reserve at least a month in advance. When you arrive, you get seated at a waiting area, while they clear your table. Order via the waiters or waitresses. Still water is chargeable. Scan QR code to order menu. Toilet is on 2nd floor (interestingly).  Prices are definitely slightly pricier than usual. The big piece of salmon is around $38 for reference. But they are all very tasty and well cooked.  The interior is really big. There's a large bell with faces, and a bridge, giving the Japan vibes. The only drawback not everyone will appreciate is the dark setting of the restaurant overall, something you need to get used to. There are many tables to seat many customers inside. It can get a bit cramp.  Overall an interesting experience. Might come again but not anytime soon.

caption: Had extremely high expectations for this place as it boasts a waiting list for over a month. AND voted most romantic restaurant in Singapore. Food was good. Steak was delicious. The COD was one of the best I‚Äôve had (but I don‚Äôt usually have fish). The dessert was visually nice and tasted decent too. Had the lemon and also the cheesecake. Lemon was sour but still tasty. The cheesecake was unbelievably good. Yes, the food was good, but was there anything above average that stood out? Not really. You are paying a premium for the environment and ambience. Total was; 2 lunch sets (beef and cod fish) plus unagi truffle sushi- almost 300sgd. Would I return? Probably not for a while.

caption: I arrived KOMA at approximately 2pm with my family (6 adults and 2 child) . Completed my main course while waiting for the rest to finish their. Some of our plates was cleared while the rest are still eating. Everyone finished their main course by 3.15 and we sat there waiting for our deserts. At around 3.40pm our deserts was still not here therefore i ask the waiter how long more will it take for our desert to be serve and his answer was, we have to clear your plates before we can serve your desert. In other words, i should have say you should not have interrupted our meal by clearing our plates while the others are having their meals. Basically, we sat there doing nothing for the past 30mins. After which the desert was serve at 3.50pm. This is my 3rd time here and the services is truly bad.  My glass of water was empty and no one bothers to top up. There's a minimum charge for our table since we have taken the table for 8 and if we knew we will forgo the baby chair. Thanks for reading and I definitely not coming bad anymore. Bye KOMA

caption: Although it is protected from the sun and there are fans, much of the available space is very warm. You're supposed to select a table and then go order from whatever stalls you want, and they will deliver the food to your table. caption: Ordered Hokkien Mee, Satays and beef noodle. This hawker have 2 famous stalls of Hokkien mee, I got the green plate one( Chia Keng). Should have bought both to try at I didn‚Äôt saw the red plate one (Ah Hock). Saw many people getting ah Hock Hokkien mee instead. The green plate Hokkien mee was not as delicious and fragrant as I thought. I have try the Changi Village one at other hawkers and I prefer that, the sauce is extremely flavourful!  The satay don‚Äôt have any char taste.. sauce still okay only. The beef noodle, for the price, acceptable. As I just came back from Taiwan, compared this to the Taiwan one is extremely different level. This bowl consist of a few slices of beef, some fried peanuts and preserved vegetables. Noodle is springy. Soup is sour and spicy abit.

caption: The best way to try the local cuisine in SG is to visit the Hawker center.  The Chomp Chomp Food Centre is one of the famous one.  Thanks my friend Alice who took me there to try the yummy SG authentic cuisine .  She knows the place well and we went there at around 5pm , she said that it would be crowded later in the evening and couldn't find a table or seats.   People are very friendly , there are many small stores selling different kind of local dishes. Everything looks so nice and yummy , would like to try them all. Of course, we have picked all the famous dishes . I have enjoyed a wonderful evening of SG yummy local cuisine.

caption: Great selection of food at Chomp Chomp.  However the best dish so far is the salted egg eggplant. Eggplant were mixed with pork or beef. But the flavors was good because the crispy texture of the salted eggs, juiciness of the eggplant and meat juries coats the eggplant.  The fried rice and noodles were good. The sambal sauce gives fried rice perfect kick of spice to the dish.  Skewers is okay even the stingray too. I had high expectations for stingray. Even grilled wings were okay. The deep fried wings are the best.  Enjoy the atmosphere of hawkers in Chomp Chomp.

caption: Loooove the food. ü•πü•π enjoyed everything here and the stall owners are friendlier than those in Lau Pa Sat. They were very polite and understanding even if we had a language barrier. Food was delicious, prepared quick and i had a great time enjoying the food esp the stingray sambal.  Just unfortunate the table beside us were a bit rude. They were speaking chinese but we could catch them talk how we‚Äôll just vlog/tiktok. We took pics of course (tourist stuff but not a lot) but hope theyd be friendlier or at least discreet if there were actual vloggers or tourists. Anyway other people there didn‚Äôt mind, so yeah we just had to ignore them and still had a great time.  We had a hard time looking for MRT going there, i think there‚Äôs a bus station nearby. Best to just ride a taxi or book Grab.  I‚Äôd visit this place again and recommend this for people looking for legit SG food.

caption: Chomp Chomp Food Centre is a popular hawker centre in Singapore that is well-known for its mouthwatering local food offerings. The food centre has a wide variety of dishes available, from Hokkien Mee to Satay, making it a great place to sample some of Singapore's most beloved hawker fare.  The quality of the food at Chomp Chomp Food Centre is undoubtedly top-notch, with many of the stalls having been in operation for decades, and the flavors are consistently excellent. However, it's worth noting that the prices at this food centre are slightly higher than at other similar hawker centres. While the quality justifies the price for some, others may find the prices a bit steep.  Despite the slightly higher prices, the atmosphere at Chomp Chomp Food Centre is lively and bustling, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists alike. With many stalls to choose from and a variety of food options available, it's a great place to try some of Singapore's most famous hawker dishes. Overall, while the prices may be a bit high, the quality of the food and the experience make Chomp Chomp Food Centre worth a visit.

caption: Located inside the Marriott lobby, this speakeasy was a fascinating post dinner excursion.  We did not have reservations but luckily got there early enough to secure seats at the bar. I would say sitting at the bar is the best spot as you can view the gamut of house-finished liquors as well as see the bartenders at work.  We were greeted with our names written in our seats which was a nice touch along with a complimentary cocktail sample. My friend and I each ordered two cocktails.  I ordered the Islay Gin & Tonic and the All About the Basil. The Islay Gin & Tonic definitely is a drink that you experience through smell first from the rosemary smoke.  I would say the All About the Basil was my favourite of the two being extremely refreshing and herbaceous.

caption: I took my friends here to celebrate one of our good friend birthday! This place is definitely on the more luxury side of cocktail bars with drinks ranging from $24 and abovez However, it was a really fun and great experience for a special occasion.  We ordered a total of 8 cocktails and a bottle of wine with our total coming up to $385 (after tax)  MY FAVORITES! üíóüç∏  01 Poolside Swizzle | $28 ‚Äî This was sweet & tangy, I love how much effort they put in displaying the drink.  02 Love is in the air | $24 ‚Äî Sweet and such an adorable display too! This is perfect for the birthday girl/boy cause it comes with a airplane tix with their name & date (great for keeping as a little souvenir)  TO AVOID ‚Äî If you're not a fan of strong flavours!  01 La Louisiana | $26 ‚Äî One of the strongest drink (they'll show you on the menu for every drink üòâ) This taste like straight up whiskey.  02 Old Cuban | $24 ‚Äî Smoky and bitter (it smells like cigars üò≠ tbh) But im sure if you're abit older you would 100% enjoy this üòÉ  So we did a walk in on a Saturday around 10PM and we're surprised they have seats! caption: Food. Eat before you go. The food is sufficient, but the real attraction here is the drinks. Service. Hit-and-miss. (The lady who let us in, and the glasses-wearing man who seated us, were friendly and helpful and fun. The other waitress was... well... maybe (hopefully!) it was a trial shift. Budget. Once tax (and an unexpected $15.45 service charge!) was included, four drinks and two dishes came to $183.55. Dress code. You're good. Our fellow guests were wearing everything from shorts and flip-flops to cocktail dresses. Where. You want me to tell you how to find the place? How do I know you're not the cops?! Table. If you can, and you're there for just drinks (which I recommend) then sit at the bar. There's a lot to see. Drinks. The breakfast negroni, which comes with a croissant, was good. As was the poolside swizzle, which is served in an inflated flamingo.

caption: East Coast Park is a fantastic coastal destination with stunning views, a well-maintained cycling track, picnic spots and great for kids.  It's a must-visit for nature lovers!  Just be mindful of crowded periods and cleanliness.

caption: For outdoor enthusiasts, East Coast Park is an absolute gem! This sprawling recreational area offers a myriad of recreational opportunities, including cycling, rollerblading, and jogging along the scenic pathways. This coastal area is a perfect blend of vibrant atmosphere , recreational activities and culinary delights
name: East Coast Park

caption: I had an amazing and relaxing time at this place! There were tons of fun activities to spend your free time, and the park stretched almost two kilometers along the east coast. The park had a well-equipped children's playground, a skating platform, and many other amenities. The beach was clean and shallow, making it the ideal spot for a Sunday outing.  Additionally, there was a jetty built alongside the beach, providing a breathtaking view of the sea and planes traversing through Changi Airport. I even heard that they have camping sites available, which seems to be popular among the locals.  Overall, I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a fun and relaxing day out. Whether you're with family, friends, or on your own, there's something for everyone at this park!
name: East Coast Park

caption: Beautiful and clean park. There is bike renting shop and many eateries. It has a really peaceful vibe. People usually do picnics and camping on Friday Saturday and sundays. A really nice place to spend evening.
name: East Coast Park

caption: It is a beautiful place to go around. You can rent a bike and ride from ECP to Marina Bay or Sentosa. You can find a really cool Hawker Center, water sport utilities and camping zone. Is quiet and secure. You can see big boat far from the beach.
name: East Coast Park

caption: This very safe and adventurous 4-level rope course is totally free of charge. Anyone from kindergarten can try this course all the way to the top. Great view of the sea & Park. Great food with live music and songs. Outdoor classroom, sand pit, water fountain, toilets...
name: East Coast Park

caption: What a lovely public amenity to have next to the water, so many people enjoying the outdoors and cycling or jogging, or walking or stopping for snacks, or sitting under the trees and watching the world go by. Quite lovely. Lots of parking available.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Coastal Grove Playground Carpark B2, many food outlet including Halal ones. Public toilet, playground, water play and next to the beach. Lots of shady big trees too. Really nice place to be for families young and old.

caption: East Coast Park is an excellent destination to spend quality time with family and friends. The park offers a wide range of activities such as resting, tending, cycling, playing and swimming. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun-filled day in Singapore.

Also, you can get bicycles on rent and there is a separate track for the same. There are a lot of other activities available for kids. You can also bring your own food and eat there. There is no entry fee as such in order to enter into the park/beach. Check out some pictures that I have clicked.

name: East Coast Park

caption: East Coast Park is a fantastic destination for outdoor enthusiasts and families seeking relaxation and fun. The park boasts a beautiful coastline, lined with sandy beaches and dotted with palm trees, creating a serene and tropical atmosphere. It's a great place to escape the city and enjoy some fresh air and sunshine. Food lovers will be delighted by the diverse dining options at East Coast Park. The park is home to a wide range of restaurants, cafes, and hawker centers that offer both local and international cuisines. From seafood to barbecued delights to traditional Singaporean dishes, there's something to satisfy every palate. East Coast Park is a wonderful recreational area that offers a plethora of activities and amenities for everyone. Its beautiful coastline, well-maintained paths, and diverse dining options make it a great destination for outdoor enthusiasts, families, and friends. Whether you're looking for a leisurely stroll, a picnic by the beach, or engaging in water sports, East Coast Park has something for everyone to enjoy.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Amazing place to walk especially during evening time, not so hot. The breeze and sea sounds will calm your mind and soul.  Really like the idea to have cycling and walking/running path, no need to worry speeding bicycle.  Try to chit chat with people nicely, you might get some surprise: Guy share his fishing tactic and one gentleman even let me walk his big dog.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Great area for a picnic with friends, family, and loved ones
name: East Coast Park

caption: I'd say that walking by the beach and riding a bike at the East Coast Park are two of my best experiences while on tour in Singapore. My senior companions decided to just sleep it off/ watch movie at the hotel during our last day in Singapore but I don't want to waste the chance to explore places so I made my own plans. Though it's raining that morning, I decided to walk from the hotel to this seaside park. It was such a joyful experience to be so close to nature! After walking by the beach, I decided to rent a bike which was cool because all you have to do is scan a QR code to do so.  It took me a while to figure it out but, luckily, I was able to unlock the bike and finally use it. This was the first time I biked in a foreign country (and all by myself) so this small adventure is quite memorable for me. Small joys!
name: East Coast Park

caption: The best place to spend time with your family and friends. You have access to the barbeque bit, but need to pre-book the ECP website. Also try bringing the Camp and stay at night at sore.
name: East Coast Park

caption: So beautiful sunset.. Nice place for gathering to bbq and walking distance from carpark. Windy and relaxing

caption: A relaxing place for all walks of people loving space, greenery, beach, sea, sand, walking, biking, skateboarding, jogging, etc etc.

caption: Love the accessibility to this place, all the way from MBS. Many spots to take breaks at for refreshing yourself. Campsites available. BBQ spots. And much more! Once a week must visit for cycling enthusiasts or as a hangout spot.

When I was there a few of the eateries were open even at wee hours of the early mornings. You have your coffee and Beans, Mac Donalds and an Indian Muslim restaurant. But I was there for some peace and time. Such a nice place to be alone.

name: East Coast Park

caption: Catch the lovely sunset at East Coast Park. Its been a tired week, brought family out for bonding and relax. Listen to the sound of the sea waves, enjoy the lovely sunset scenery. The view is awesome. Its a nice place to relax with your family. With a big opening field behind to play ball games, sandy beach at the front. And we happened to saw a group of parrot lovers flying their birds around the area. It's a real bonus to us.
name: East Coast Park

caption: It is a wonderful place to visit. A truly mesmerizing sunset. Excellent cleanliness and neatness. Proper management of BBQ pits. A place to sit with family and friends. At night it looks fabulous in case you want to sit alone.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Hands down the best park in SG for Marathon runners and cyclists!
name: East Coast Park

caption: Dedicated cycling routes along the park make my commuting rides very enjoyable during weekdays early morning and evening. Well, I heard weekends are pretty crowded. Of course, I've seen on my commutes even Friday evening can be relatively more crowded than other weekdays evening. As of Jan 2023, the whole park is fully accessible apart from construction areas. During new year day and the holiday day after it, I have seen certain areas were extremely packed with campers.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Always can see many people relaxing at beach side with beautiful view and good options of food
name: East Coast Park

caption: A place to go for casual landscape photography. You get a happy lonely feelings which is what I want in this place. At the same time there are  restaurants ready to fill your hunger. Do not miss renting a bicycle to ride safely along paths parallel to the coastline. I had a wonderful time. If you have freedom of time than go during one of the weekdays.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Just stunning! Rent a bike and cycle for miles with stunning views!
name: East Coast Park

caption: The pictures and views say everything of this amazing place. Good place for cycling and hangout with families during weekends.  There‚Äôre bicycle rental around as well. Or else, if you plan to ride, you can get Anywheel or bicycle rental around the park as well.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Very good place for morning evening walk, jog and cycling.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Still the best beach in sg with all the amenities. A good tourist spot without the need to spend any money.
name: East Coast Park

caption: East cost park offers very good view, it‚Äôs very chilling and relaxing place to go to, although the walk to East Coast park was abit long from the mrt, but is worth it, the place is cool and windy
name: East Coast Park

caption: The best place to relax on during weekends and holidays...
name: East Coast Park

caption: Probably the longest park in town? I'd think so, but that's not the only great thing about the East Coast Park, as it has a plethora of activities available throughout its length! From wakeboarding, to camping  sites, from giant metal slides, to small water ones... It even has a great skate park and beaches you can use for swimming... It has so many things to do that it's impossible not to recommend the visit! :)
name: East Coast Park

caption: Great place for kids. Huge park with many play areas. So realxing.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Great place for cycling but avoid weekends as the place is very crowded.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Ever evolving stretch of green park in Singapore. Lots of sporting activity options and more recently a whole new slate of eateries and shops
name: East Coast Park

caption: it‚Äôs always a nice place to run in the morning and eat breakfast afterwards. a nice picnic place with kids also, very relaxing seeing the water and nature
name: East Coast Park

caption: It is a beautiful beach and many conveniences such as near a toilet except if only it is well clean.Many people using it didn't bother to help keep the toilet clean.Tissue paper everywhere.I can't even use the toilet bowl as 2 of them were dirtied with feces.The smell of the toilet,I really can't handle it. I took my family there for a night camp but was disturbed with loud music by a group of people karaoke, 2 different groups of people,actually. Imagine the noise,with people from different groups singing to different songs at one go.They like competing with each other,who have a better voice.They started in the afternoon until all the way to 12 in the morning.We went all the way to East coast beach, thought of having a quiet and enjoyable day at the beach after a long week of working . Unfortunately,that didn't happened. At first we thought of moving to another section of the beach but it was crowded on that day. I'm not complaining,it is a public place . People can do whatever they want. Its just that we are sharing this public place with other people. Do have some courtesy and common sense when you are at places like this. Please lower down your karaoke set volume, We are not there to hear you sing. It is not a competition for you to compete with other group and it is certainly not a concert. Do keep track of the time.People who are camping there do want to get some rest and sleep.We love the beach but i don't think i want to bring my family to the beach again any time soon.
name: East Coast Park

caption: A nice coast to take a stroll in the evening, to get a taste of sea air and relax. And probably the best part is tasty barbecue with fresh coconut juice or a beer.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Good place picnic, cycling,relaxing
name: East Coast Park

caption: Not adviced to visit on weekend as it would be over crowded at almost the full length of beach. Good picnic spot for family and friends and can book BBQ pits for any events or in general too.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Nice place and the beach clean for play water , like it .. can rilex and enjoying the win
name: East Coast Park

caption: Place to create memories with family. The sea and breeze will calm your body, mind and soul. We went camping but nevertheless, even a walk is worth it. The sunrise view at east coast park could just be your perfect instagrammable pic.   Shops nearby to get snacks adds to the fun. Must visit for every one in search of rejuvenation.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Best Beach of Singapore . Best Part is Early morning walk.
name: East Coast Park

caption: Best pasta in town. Have tried a bunch of their pasta dishes and there have not been any misses. Favorite go-to dishes are beef raggu, lobster ravioli, and the uni.  The minus would be the limited number of appetizers and sides on the menu. Serving is rather small for the price tag.  Best to make a reservation one week in advance. Generous seating time of 2 hrs.
name: Pasta Bar

caption: The quality of the food and service was great, freshly cooked handmade pasta. Lobster ravioli is my favorite. I enjoyed watching the chefs preparing food as I was  seated at the counter. Nice place to chill out with friends. The price is slightly on the higher side, but i still think it's value for money. Anyone craving authentic pasta should give it a try .Make reservations in advance as the restaurant is usually packed with diners.

caption: I had a memorable evening at Pasta Bar. The greeter was amazing, radiating friendliness and positive energy. The food was great, and watching the chef prepare the dishes felt like a well-orchestrated performance. Though disappointed that the Sicilian Cannolo was no longer on the menu, the overall experience was enjoyable. The only minor drawbacks were the dripping air conditioning, which could use maintenance. Despite these small issues, I highly recommend Pasta Bar for its impeccable service, delicious food, and inviting ambiance. I left satisfied and eager to return

caption: while we had an amazing time here on this dinner, i would say that the standard has slightly dropped compared to my previous visits. especially for the uni tagliolini. the sauce and noodles just don‚Äôt hit the same as it did, but still very good nonetheless! however the ambience was lovely, and it was good entertainment watching the chefs as we had our meal  do get the limoncello when you‚Äôre here!! it‚Äôs literally one of the best types of alcohols around. it was also pretty cute that they gave a bag of fresh pasta after our meal since we were here for a birthday celebration :)  with this being said, i am still looking forward to the next time i get to dine here

caption: Great service at pasta bar, waitresses are very friendly! The pasta I ordered - Crab Pappardelle and Lobster Ravioli. I sat at the counter and was able to see the chefs making and cooking the pasta :) However, one thing I‚Äôve noticed is that the pasta turns cold quickly and the waitress explained the chefs usually serves it warm and thus turn cold fast. I guess one way to keep your food warm is to sit outside the restaurant under the scorching hot sun, otherwise you‚Äôd have to devour it immediately after it‚Äôs served and take photos quickly! ;)

caption: We had a marvelous set lunch that hit all the right spots.  At a reasonable price, manned by an awesome bubbly, caring and attentive crew.  We started with a very authentic rendition of Caesar Salad that had nice bits of anchovies & crunchy croutons to complete the experience.  Baby Romaine was fresh and cut to nice size for easy eating.  We tried the Ragu pasta,, crab pasta and the carbonara.  All 3 were perfect renditions of the originals.  Pastas were freshly handmade, rightly al dente and the sauces were amazing.  Portions were generous with ample shavings of Parmesan to top it off.  Really a first class pasta experience.  Dessert was a nice cannelloni with pistachios and lemon cream.  Reminded us of La Strada which has since closed.
name: Pasta Bar

caption: Place was crowded when we went for dinner on Thursday, but we had reservations, so was okay.  Water is $3 per pax, free flow, with choice of a slice of lemon/grapefruit / cucumber or lime, but they mentioned is donate to some charity, so I guess made it feels worthwhile.  Server was patient to explain the menu which was not the usual pasta choices. They didn't have aglio olio base.  Bread was served warm with olive oil and balsamic, nice.  Rabbit pasta - I didn't dare to try, but was supposed to be nice. The lamb pasta was nice, but a bit too creamy feel at the end. The crab pasta wasn't as nice as expected.  Overall, felt a bit pricey for the food.

caption: Went there with high expectations after seeing all the reviews. But was heavily disappointed and will not visit again.  Place and service are good. I had a pleasant time talking to the staffs while waiting for the food.  Pasta are just overrated. Ordered the signature ragu beef and the prawn ones. But both dishes are boring to eat, over al dente and dry. My wife and I did not speak a single word when eating the pasta because we knew the standard is off. This is especially disappointing for the high price.  I really like the service of the staffs but had to leave my honest review so everyone does not have high expectation when visiting there.

caption: Used to love pasta bar, but my recent visit just made me feel like the money was not well spent. Went around 2pm and got seated outside w/o reservation. Hostess while waiting for us to order was standing right behind me (at the counter by the door) rapping her knuckles against it repeatedly, which made the experience feel very hurried. Pasta was alright. We got two mid range pastas and two still water ($3/pax) and that set us back almost $100 for a lunch with not much ambience. For those going, try to get a table inside esp at the countertop where you can see some action and feel more hospitality.
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Disclaimer: Rating is solely based on taste of food.  Came on a Friday night at 6.30pm to celebrate my husband‚Äôs birthday. We made a reservation a month in advance ‚Äòcos we saw that a reservation is required for the experience tasting menu, but do note it‚Äôs a different reservation from the normal one (need to pick the specific experience tasting reservation and is available at 8pm seating; and also, the reservation we made was for a normal table seating so we weren‚Äôt able to have the experience tasting).  Somehow, a couple next to us was having the experience menu even though we were at the first seating so we tried our luck with the waitress, who said it wasn‚Äôt available til the second seating and had to be pre-booked in advance (also, making me very confused since the couple next to us was having it during the first seating‚Ä¶ ü§î like how did they book this for the first seating when the website didn‚Äôt have this option? Is it strictly for second seating or can we make a request in advance for the first seating?)  Service crew was very professional and attentive. With the open concept kitchen right in front of us, it was difficult not to have our eyes on the chefs showing off their cooking skills. My husband and I caught one of the ladles dropping on the floor and one of the chef picking it up to hang back in it‚Äôs original place without washing it, and proceeded to scoop (not sure if it‚Äôs broth or water) from a huge pot to cook the pastas. We were mortified‚Ä¶ informed the manager (who was really so professional) and got them to discard the whole pot and remove the ladle for washing. Tbh if I ever came back again it‚Äôll be because of the wonderful service and professionalism from the service crew. üíØ  Moving on to the food, we ordered the pan-seared Hokkaido Scallop ($34), Grilled Mediterranean Octipus ($34), Lumache (lamb ragu; $36) and Sea Urchin Tagliolini ($42).  The size of the antipasti isn‚Äôt too much so we were fortunately able to finish them. The Hokkaido scallop was fresh and good; paired with sweet corn pur√©e, crispy Parma ham and celeriac slaw. It was an interesting combination and the best way to eat this is to have each element in the same bite (somehow eating them separately made me find this dish very weird). Although it was good, I don‚Äôt find this dish exactly impressive.  The Grilled Mediterranean octopus was grilled to the perfect texture. Paired with baby potatoes, black olives, garlic cream and crumbs, I find myself not quite a fan of this dish. Although the octopus texture was good, the other ingredients didn‚Äôt quite complement the octopus. The garlic cream was a tad bitter and the crumbs made this dish drier. Highly recommend skipping this dish.  The Lumache (Lamb Ragu) was slightly gamey but still acceptable. I‚Äôm not a fan of the gamey mutton taste but I could accept the taste of this dish so I would say it‚Äôs considered pretty good. The pasta texture was Al dente and I like how bits of the pasta were charred which gave it an extra texture. Cream was alright, but this dish as a whole wasn‚Äôt exactly impressive, so personally I wouldn‚Äôt order it again.  Lastly, the sea urchin tagliolini which was so highly raved. The sea urchin was fresh, the sauce wasn‚Äôt too jelak and the pasta texture was good (Al dente). However, there were bits of ginger in it which masked the taste of the dish somehow. I felt like I was eating creamy ginger pasta, but I believe the ginger was supposed to prevent the dish from becoming too jelak. Nonetheless, not a fan of this dish.  For the price point and the dishes I‚Äôve had, I would say it‚Äôs not worth coming back. But to be fair, there‚Äôre so many other highly raved dishes that I‚Äôve yet to try such as the Crab Pappardelle, Lobster Ravioli, Tagliatelle (beef ragu) and Truffle Fettucini. And of course the experience menu. Will be back to review these remaining dishes and hopefully those will be worth the hype!
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Really loved the food there, especially the sides. Served up some flavours that were quite unexpected in a good way. Pasta was good too, cooked to the right texture.  The vibe there was really chill too, and the service staff were very friendly and helpful, providing recommendations on the menu too. I really liked the counter seats with the open kitchen, which gave a more intimate experience. Nonetheless, those seats gave me a much closer view of the cooking process, and it freaked me out a little.  I was hoping that the open kitchen would mean that diners could engage with the cooks, but the kitchen staff looked bored, were mostly disengaged, with some using their phones at the counter. It wasn't pleasant watching them work as they looked sloppy. Additionally, I was also a little concerned about hygiene, watching them use ingredients with ungloved hands, face masks hanging over the chin and not on the face, while chatting with each other over a plate of food, etc. This is not something diners would want to see.
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: The Pasta Bar is all about pastas. obviously, and actually it's more than that. There are pastas of all kinds, and they come with lots of choices of meats or vegetables, like beef, pork, duck, uni, crab, truffle, pumpkin, chickpea and more. So it is one of those times where I have no problem choosing a pasta dish I like due to huge variety of pastas available.  But having good pasta dishes is not enough for me, I need good appetiser and dessert to complete my adventure, and this restaurant fulfils just that. The place is of nice cosy rustic setting with the brick walls, yellow lamps, wine bottle ornaments, juxtaposing with the chic open kitchen counter in the centre of the space. And lots of dry pastas hung around the counter to further emphasise The Pasta Bar has The Pastas. Sitting at the counter is pretty fun since one can watch the chefs in action and witness occasional flamb√©s during the preparation of the pastas.  To complement the great food is the great service here. The service crew takes very good care of us patrons. And good wine recommendation by the young lady staff. It is fruity and refreshing.  Sea Urchin Tagliolini is full of creamy umami due to the sea urchin cream. The cute pieces of sea urchin decked on top of the pasta is very fresh and sweet. So good are the sea urchin that I wish there is more of them added. Tobiko roe gives a nice refreshing element in terms of taste and texture to the pasta. Tagliolini is firm to touch on the surface and soft to bite, in other words, is of perfect texture. The portion of tagliolini is very big, but I can actually finish it due to how satisfying this is on the palates.  I love Pan Seared Hokkaido Scallops here. The scallops with seared surface are so succulent and also briny in taste, accentuated by the mild sweetness of the sweet corn puree and the meaty flavour of crispy Parma ham. I especially like the celeriac slaw added because it is so refreshing in taste and has a nice crunchiness that contrasts well with the other ingredients. A well-executed dish.  The raspberry semi freddo of Raspberry Millefoglie is so good that I totally enjoy just this by itself. The characteristics of raspberry is fine-tuned to the perfect balance of nuanced sweetness, subtle tart taste and soft floral aroma. The puff pastry makes it even better by introducing the crispy, flaky texture and wholesome taste of wheat. Since the semi freddo and savoiardi are frozen, need some brute force to cut out the pieces for savouring. So I suggest letting this dessert sit for a while to thaw a bit for easier handling and richer flavours.  I'm impressed with this place. Now I can see why it is so popular. The portion of the pasta here is big, so if one has concerns about finishing it, either go easy on the prior meal for extra stomach space, or share the pasta dish with appetisers and sides.  For pasta feast, this is the place I will go to.  Thoughts: Pasta can be luxurious dish too.
name: Pasta Bar

caption: Had a celebratory lunch at Pasta Bar and we LOVED the experience! First, we were seated at the counter and was treated to Pasta Bar‚Äôs talented chefs making and cooking pasta. Second, the 3 pastas we ordered were absolutely delicious - cacio e pepe, the ragu and prawn pasta. Our favourite was the prawn, an excellent recommendation by one of the staff. 3 pastas (and no sides) was just nice for the two of us, can‚Äôt wait to be back to try the other dishes.  [Edit] And went back we did on Sun, 11 Jun for the experience menu! The experience menu was a pasta lover‚Äôs dream - we had 4 pasta dishes originating from different parts of Italy with varying sauce bases & meats. We loved it, but do come hungry as the pastas fill up even the most ravenous of eaters really fast. My favourite was the squid ink pasta, with the lobster linguine coming a close second. The staff also did a great job in explaining each pasta dish, really enjoyed that context. I wasn‚Äôt a big fan of the dessert (cannoli), but to each their own. The entire experience lasted about 1.5 hours.

caption: Visited this unassuming yet stylish restaurant for lunch, where pasta is handmade (!) and hung to dry in the open-kitchen for diners to admire.  Greeted with a welcome serving of bread, as we glanced through what is a decent variety of mains for a Lunch Set Menu (although you don‚Äôt quite have a choice with the Antipasti and Dolce dessert). You have to order bottled water - I was told that tap water is not served here.  Service was excellent, professional, and accommodating. Our request to change one of the Cannolo (which contains Sheep‚Äôs milk ricotta - be warned) was acceded to, with no extra charge. That was a great move as one of us was otherwise aghast with the thought of sheep‚Äôs milk!  The visually-satiating plated burrata appetiser included juicy, refreshing chunks of heirloom tomatoes, and an earthy basil pesto which brought the dish together impeccably. This was ordered out-of-menu; the caesar antipasti was alright, but nothing much to shout about.  Next up are the pasta mains. All three were unique, al-dente, and absolutely delicious. I would rank the creamy Cacio e Pepe first, then the rich beef ragu tagliatelle, and then the (most unique!) crab pappardelle in terms of least adventurous to most. There is a distinct umami flavour in the crab pappardelle - so that made for an interesting savour along with the saffron pairing. That being said, if you are the average pasta person, each of the mains are on the heavier side of things, so you will likely feel ‚Äògelat‚Äô if you aren‚Äôt sharing your mains.  The desserts were even better than the mains, which made for a satisfying conclusion to the lunch. I was chatting with a waitress, and we both agreed that the crisp sheep‚Äôs milk cannolo was much, much tastier than it sounded. The apple strudel was impeccable - highly recommend it.  Two (perhaps fussy) observations - there was noticeable condensation on the restaurant‚Äôs ceiling corners, and air con maintenance conducted during lunch service. Inevitable as maintenance goes, perhaps it could be slightly more subtle, for the price point and ambience.  Hope to be back to try the lobster pasta!  4.4 / 5

caption: Was here for a birthday dinner and it was disappointing.  Beef tartare had a great portion of meat but was lacking in capers. It wasn't executed well and didn't have the smoothness from a good beef tartare.  Uni pasta had very little uni and the sauce was done poorly. The pasta clumped together and the whole dish was bad. I'm not sure if it's the cheese or alcohol in it but it made the sauce too sharp/ sour.  Here's a comparison of the uni pasta from 1.5 years ago and now.  The service was good.  A far cry from what it was. Won't be back again.

caption: Nearest subway: Outram Park Station, Exit H (No. 4), then walk 5 minutes to destination.  This is one of my favourite handmade pasta restaurants in Singapore and it is refreshing to be back after the pandemic. Their food remain consistent in taste and presentation, along with their customer service.  It is a medium sized restaurant in a shophouse-liked environment with comfortable seating areas like the bar counter with handles for your bags. Washrooms were clean as well.  Visit: Birthday dinner for 2 pax (small eaters) Environment: 4/5 Bathrooms: 4/5 Service: 4/5, service associates were attentive, approachable and polite. Food: 4/5, and husband rated 8.5/10. Human suitability: Family with adult children, couples, and friends.  Thank you for the take-home pasta birthday gift. It was a sweet and sincere gesture for your patrons.  Worth a visit: 100% What about a return visit: Heaven YES
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: This date night favourite may not have a distinctive name but Pasta Bar sure delivers. Their $30+ pastas pack so much flavour in their delicate portions that the 2 of us didn't regret splurging on 3 pastas during our exclusive night out here.  Crab parpadelle ($36) ü¶Ä 5/5  This was the star of the night, and could be found on everyone's bar counter. The pasta looks strikingly jaundiced but don't be put off! Its colour probably has something to do with its deeply umami flavour. This was so unique we should have ordered 3 of these.  Tagiatelle ($34) üçù 4/5  We thought we should get a pasta with a little meat so we ordered this tagiatelle full of tender, thick clumps of pulled beef. Definitely a delight for the senses but it couldn't beat the crab.  Ciriole carbonara ($34) ü•ì 4/5  We were greedy for a third so we tried the ever-safe choice of carbonara. The ciriole sure was thick and chewy and definitely lent a unique house-made dimension to this dish. The carbonara was done the authentic dry style which was satisfying with the cheese at first but got a teeny bit clumpy in the end.  Water ($3 each) üí¶  At least they charge you the same for sparkling and non-sparkling! There's also free bread at least.

caption: It‚Äôs hard to get a booking for this place so remember to book in advance. The burrata salad was on point, a must order. We ordered Lumache, a lamb Ragu and it was good. Lobster ravioli was okay but not that memorable. The pasta are cooked al dente to our liking.  Sparking water comes with choice of 4 different garnishes. We had all 4 desserts on the menu. I personally like the salted caramel tart the most. Price wise it‚Äôs on the steeper side.  But I have to comment the staff. Great service from all of them. Besides that, all of them were professional and knew the menu well. You could tell they were sincere as well, hence the 5 stars. Well done to the team.

opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Pasta Bar is a popular restaurant that specializes in serving freshly made pasta dishes. The restaurant's ambiance is modern and relaxed, making it a great spot for a meal with friends or family.  The quality of the pasta dishes is amazing, noting that the pasta is cooked al dente and the sauces are flavorful and well-balanced. In addition to their pasta dishes, the restaurant also offers a variety of appetizers and desserts.  For our visit, we ordered Wagyu beef carpaccio for the antipasti. Thinly sliced wagyu beef topped with sea urchin mayo, yuzu gel, pickled cucumber, seaweed dressing, and caviar. With the combination of all these ingredients in a single bite, it tastes complex, layered flavor profile with a variety of textures. It is so amazing! The wagyu beef carpaccio is priced at $36.  For the pasta, we ordered the Truffle Fettuccini. Freshly cooked al dente fettuccini topped with parmigiano and generous amount of fresh shaved winter black truffle! Hands down, it is one of the best truffle fettuccini you could get in Singapore. The truffle fettuccini is priced at $46  We wanted to order Sea Urchin Tagliolini. However, they don't have it on that day. Hence, we ordered the Lobster Ravioli. The lobster ravioli has a very nice texture, the taste is rich with the lobster flavor. The lobster ravioli is priced at $36  Overall, it is a really great experience. Pasta Bar is a great spot for those looking for delicious fresh pasta in Singapore!  Follow me on Instagram @itsandresnaps
name: Pasta Bar

caption: Had the set lunch with Beef tagliatelle. It was wonderful at first bite. Pasta was very fresh which really elevated the dish overall. Service was great and it is wonderful. Perhaps it was the set lunch menu and the food just felt a little underwhelming. Will be back to try the full menu to give it a fairer review then.

caption: I‚Äôll split this review into three parts: 1. Food 2. Service 3. Hygiene  Food - the scallops were very tasty and well seasoned, but just a tad cold by the time it reached our table. That being said, it was still the best dish of the night. The broccolini was simple, fragrant and crunchy; not much to complain about. The pasta was however, honestly quite disappointing. Despite the name, the pastas did not have enough shine to be the main star of the night. We had the Rigatoni alla Norma and the Prawn Spaghetti alla Chiatarra. The rigatoni was still a teeny bit raw, but the eggplant with the sauce was good. The prawn spaghetti was unfortunately too salty, and the sauce just seemed like a random mish mash with no distinctive layers.  Service - the service was great, which is why i still gave this two stars  Hygiene - the chefs had their masks down, which is fine given that they are working in a kitchen, but one of the chefs did not even wear gloves, and was coughing and sneezing without covering his mouth/nose, and used the same hand to season the food he cooks. To me that‚Äôs quite a turn off even if the food is really good

caption: I had the experience menu on Monday 27th February 2023.  It is very convenient to get to, a short walk from Outram mrt. When we arrived, we were greeted by the friendly and welcoming staff.  We had 3 appetisers to start with, everyone of them immaculately crafted by the chefs and bringing a big punch of flavour. If it wasn't for the fact that I had 4 more pastas coming up, I would have asked for seconds.  For the pastas we were given 4 different pasta that all brought their own unique flavours. I never thought that pasta could come with such different dimensions of flavours. The pasta was al Dante, texture was perfect.  My favourite had to be the cheese wheel pasta with pork cheek. Anyway there are 26 different pastas from the menu to choose from and I can't wait to try them all.  The dessert was a DIY canollo set that came with prosecco and lemnocelli sorbet to add a refreshing finish to it. Reservations are necessary as seats are hard to come by.

caption: Came here during Christmas, we made our reservations like two months before we came here. Was strange because it was not so crowded around Keong Saik Road, possibly all Singaporean families decided to stay at home due to rising cost and defaulted menu(means restaurant usually give u a Christmas menu to choose from). But this pasta bar is not doing that, which makes me happy.  Service is delightful, it was full-house. Chef even offered us to help get us a photo.  The pasta is al-dente. Uni is fresh, pasta texture is good, creamy with umami flavour. We also like the ravioli, and the grilled octopus. House pour is also good it goes along with the food. Seafood must go with White wines although you can also order red.  Price is steep because of the premium ingredients as expected.  You can chill at this bar and get entertained by the chefs cooking in the kitchen. It sort of become another entertainment besides speaking to your partner. Will come again to try other dishes.

opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: The food and service at Pasta Bar are top-notch.  I was seated in front of the open kitchen where I could observe the chefs whip up the pasta dishes. When my server noticed that my bag was a little too bulky, she offered to shift it to another chair. I was also rather impressed that for the still water, a choice of citrus garnish (orange, lemon, lime or grapefruit) is offered. As I was celebrating a friend's birthday, they gifted my friend a bag of fresh pasta, and I thought this was a nice gesture.  For starters, I got the pan seared Hokkaido scallops ($34). The scallops were so juicy and went well with the sweet corn puree. The parma ham was also very crispy and its flavours contrasted well with the crunchy celeraic slaw. This is one dish with various flavours and textures that keeps you coming back for more.  For my main, I got the Ciriole Carbonara ($34). The pasta was cooked al dente. The guanciale was fried till it was crispy which gave it a nice crunch. Unfortunately I found the guanciale a little too salty.  But overall, I loved that this is one of the few places where you can get authentic carbonara.  As a side, I got the grilled asparagus ($16). The stalks of asparagus were so tender. The bits of hazelnuts also added a nice crunch to the dish. But the star of the show was the garlic and anchovies puree atop the asparagus, which provided a good umami dimension to the dish.
name: Pasta Bar

The carbonara comes with meat that is slightly on the saltier side which was surprisingly really good as it cuts through the thick creamy carbonara sauce. Carbonara is usually ‚Äújelat‚Äù and hard to take another bite towards the end, but because of the meat, the pasta was enjoyable down to the last spoon.

caption: Knowing that we went during dinner rush, they were still able to accomodate us without having any reservation. Goes to show how the team is flexible and very dedicated in providing good customer experience. We were greeted with the most friendly and welcoming staff. Peter was the one who served us and he made sure to give us drinks as soon as we were seated. He was kind enough to explain the menu and even made some recommendations for appetizers. We got the Wagyu beef carpaccio and to our suprise that it was served right away. It was so good. Ella which is the manager also recommended the Pan seared Hokkaido scallop and it was absolutely delicious. Must try! For our pasta, we got the Circiole Carbonara and it was so good. We also got the Lobster Ravioli which I promise to get every time I eat here. For me it was the best!! Super great job to the chef! Overall, it was just a great dining experience! Ella the manager was very welcoming and made sure that we were attended to all our needs. Kudos to her and the entire team for making it a very good time for us. We‚Äôll surely be back in no time as the ambiance is very cozy and the food is great.

caption: Thank you pasta bar for making my fianc√©'s birthday a memorable one. Such a lovely and cozy atmosphere coupled by great service and even greater food.  If you have yet to visit, DO MAKE RESERVATIONS as the restaurant is usually packed with diners.  If your go to starter is burrata, why not give their fresh whipped buffalo milk a try and let the natural sweetness take you on a journey.  Up for some wild game? How about the duck rigatoni that was just the right balance on the palate.  Carbonara is a crowd favourite and this fully aims to please. Stepping away from the egg and cream sauce, the fresh pasta coated in a light  cheese based sauce rounded up the meals nicely with the wild mushrooms and crispy salty bacon bits.  Overall I would recommend visiting more than once as they change their menu every 4 months.

caption: Most disappointing of all was service.  Visited for lunch today, asked for a table for 2 with no booking, service staff said to wait as she needed to check with chefs if there were tables even though 70% of the place was empty.  Waiter went in, walked around, served other people, did not seem to be checking on tables until I went in and asked again, only then did she lead us to table.  Got seated at the worst possible seat, next to the open kitchen fan where fumes came out even though there were about 10 other seats left.  Chef was sniffing on his own pasta before cooking, as if he was checking if it went bad.  Halfway through, I could barely hear my partner talk since another waiter was furiously throwing utensils into a bucket after drying with cloth.  Pasta was average at best, never coming back.

caption: Came to celebrate a birthday. We ordered the scallops for starters - the bacon bits and corn puree was a lovely combination, not too sure about the coleslaw tho. We got the crab pasta and beef ragu pasta, both were excellent - pasta cooked perfectly and beautiful texture. Crab pasta was flavourful and there were enough crab bits in it. It could get a bit too heavy after a while due to such a strong flavour, but it was still really good. The beef ragu was really nice, with enough ragu too.  The price here is a bit on the higher end, but i think for the quality of food you get, it is worth it. Take note that you are charged for water per head, and there's no option of tap water.  Staff was also abit aggressive, and I felt a bit uncomfortable when she kept pushing us to order drinks. Service could be slightly improved.  For birthdays, they give you a portion of fresh pasta which i felt was really thoughtful.

caption: It‚Äôs extremely hard to make reservation and you have to put down your cc details. And we had to give our cc details almost immediately in order to secure the seats. It‚Äôs super last minute but we‚Äôve been wanting to try the food so we still did it.  Food wise, it‚Äôs by far the best pasta I‚Äôve had in SG. We were seated at the bar table and it wasn‚Äôt too cramped. Love the ambience and will be back again!
