caption: The food selection was really good. Service was great! They need to add on more staff as my food was served abit cold. I was seated at the counter and could literally take my pasta from the chef/cook. I wonder why they couldn‚Äôt serve the customers who are seated at the counter like how those Japanese sushi chef do. But they needed to wait for the service staff to bring it to me. Also at counter I was under the aircon so that didn‚Äôt help my already cold pasta. However I am still willing to give them another go and will come back. The set lunch is really worth it $45++ for one salad, one pasta and one dessert.

caption: I recently had the pleasure of dining at this establishment and was blown away by the quality of their food and service.  First of all, the pasta dishes were absolutely delicious. I tried several different types of pasta, and each one was cooked to perfection with the ideal texture and flavor. If you love Italian food, you're sure to find a pasta dish that will satisfy your cravings.  But it's not just the food that impressed me ‚Äì the service here was also top-notch. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly, and he went above and beyond to ensure that our dining experience was enjoyable. He was also very attentive to our needs, and our glasses were never empty for long.  The ambiance of the restaurant was also very pleasant. The d√©cor was elegant and modern, creating a comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. It was the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing meal with friends or family.  Overall, I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great pasta restaurant
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Service was impeccable and pasta was great! High recommended to make reservations before going. We walked in on a Sunday at 12, right when they open and they have no walk in tables available. We got lucky as a reservation cancelled last minute.  We had the smoked duck ravioli, truffle uni pasta and beef ragu. The pasta were all cooked al dente and flavourful. However the uni pasta did get a little jialat after a while.  Do note that still water is charged at $3 per person. You can add garnishes to it (lemon/grapefruit/rosemary etc) but well, it‚Äôs still water.
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Inconsistent quality. Pasta was served much too watery, especially as compared to my previous visit a mere three weeks prior.  It also seems that in those three weeks, practically the entire staff had been replaced by new hires, and the standard of operations took a significant hit in the process.  An example of a regression would be the fact that in my previous visit I was offered to taste my ordered wine before it was served. This time, it was served without a confirmation, and was poured haphazardly (some wine spilled!)  While I personally did not have to wait too long for my reserved table (5-10 mins), a customer ahead of me was forced to wait fifteen minutes to get their table, and a significant backlog of waiting patrons seemed to have been built.  In the past, I would have recommended this restaurant in a heartbeat. However, I must now warn you that your experience may be incredibly disappointing if you were expecting the quality service of before.
name: Pasta Bar

caption: The food was excellent, however, we were seated adjacent to the order station, with the individual organising the orders standing nearby throughout the meal. While I appreciate the bar-style concept, I would have expected a better seating arrangement given that we had made a booking for a birthday celebration a month in advance.
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Extremely pleased with the food we had at Pasta Bar.  They have a wide variety of pasta dishes, making it hard for us to decide which to try.  We ordered one starter, two mains, and one dessert.  Grilled Mediterranean Octopus Octopus was well-cooked, and the texture was great. The garlic cream and crumbs did not overpower the flavour of the octopus.  Duck Agnolotti My husband's fav dish. There was a hint of truffle that did not overpower the duck flavour. Each ravioli was stuffed with generous duck confit, which was extremely flavourful. I could taste the fattiness within the duck with each bite.  Prawn spaghetti alla Chiatarra This was my fav dish. The pasta was perfect and al dente. Went really well with the seafood sauce. We ran out of bread and the restaurant manager gave us extra bread to finish the sauce!  Sicilian Cannolo First time trying. Surprisingly light for sheep cheese and went well with the crust and pistachio. Overall, a nice way to end the meal, but nothing extra-ordinary.  Overall, i'll give it a 4 out of 5, with certain areas for improvement. - Making reservations may get mildly stressful as they neither pick up phone calls nor reply to FB & IG messages. The manager did say that they will reply to emails so i'll recommend to email them if you have issues with booking. - They also did not pick up the note I indicated when i booked - that this was for an anniversary dinner. So the dessert did not come with any greetings. Thought it would have been a nice gesture if they did.  Will still return again to try the other pastas!
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Came here with very high expectation. Alas, the lobster meat was mushy. The pasta was a tad oily and tasted very much like braised ee fu noodles from a Chinese restaurant actually. Nonetheless, I will be back to try the lamb pasta another day
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: Came here ytd for lunch based on recommendation from a friend. We were seated at the bar counter, almost near to the corner, under the aircon. There was a condensation that dripped once onto my shoulder. Forgotten to mention to the staff after my lunch, so hopefully something could be done. But it was all okay - everything smelt so good from the chefs' cooking that made me forget about it.  Staff in general were friendly and attentive. Service was good. They constantly checked in with us on the food etc. We ordered the beef ragu pasta, Lobster Ravioli, grilled asparagus and the raspberry dessert. Prices could be on a high side but the food was to our liking! Pasta tasted fresh and al dente. Although I personally preferred the asparagus to be grilled further but the brown sauce and nuts were a good pairing! In addition for wine, we have enjoyed the Savignon Blanc and the Chianti.  I would also like to extend sincere thanks to the chefs who gave us an opportunity to try the Crab Fettuccine, which was good! Cream was just nice, not too overdone (There's this taste of sea). It made the lunch experience memorable, especially since it was for my hubby's birthday as well. Thank you!
name: Pasta Bar
opening_hours: Wednesday, 6 to 11 pm; Thursday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Friday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Saturday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Sunday, 12 to 3 pm, 6 to 11 pm; Monday, 6 to 11 pm; Tuesday, 6 to 11 pm. Hide open hours for the week

caption: I came here for the pasta, and I ended up leaving having made a new friend named Nic. TL;DR This is some of the best food and hospitality I‚Äôve experienced in a long time. Pasta Bar has rightfully earned its following.  If you‚Äôre one for theatrics (or simply have pyromaniac tendencies), please have a seat at the bar if you can. The chefs whip up absolute magic before your very eyes and it‚Äôs quite a sight.  The scallops were absolutely mind blowing. I‚Äôm not one for corn but the base of pur√©ed corn; that surprising creaminess paired with the sweetness of the scallops contrasted well with the shards of crispy, salty Parma ham. Flavors and textures I never thought possible on a mere plate, truly to die for.  Whenever I‚Äôm here, burrata and tagliatelle is the way to go. The pasta is Al dente and bites back in the best way possible. With a rich ragu that‚Äôs been so cooked for so long, it is too tender and clings to the noodles for dear life.  And to Nic, thank you for your warm hospitality and the little bag of precious, handmade pasta to take home. Fear not, I‚Äôll be back!
name: Pasta Bar

caption: With an array of hand made pasta shapes and flavours, the restaurant spoils you for choice. Some choices however, are better than others. Go for the Lumache and Saffron Crab Papparadelle, the others are far too salty. While the Reginetta entices with its ruffles and the Pici holds its sauce well, the combination of heavy handed oiling and multiple salty ingredients overshadows what could be a delicious textural experience. Simple, rustic and hearty, is what pasta should be. The style here seems more northern, with nary a tomato in sight except for the beef tagliatelle which seemed too commonplace to order but may try if a return visit is made. Overall not a bad experience with friendly and obliging service and some interesting and well executed desserts.

caption: Second time visiting this establishment and again I was not disappointed. Ordered the Hokkaido Scallop and Lobster Linguine for 2. Not to mention the fresh and sweet lobster that accompanied the dish. For dessert we had a chocolate tart which was equally delicious. To add on, the service was as good as the food. The waiters and waitresses were friendly, welcoming and accommodating. Pasta Bar is one of my favourite Italian restaurant in Singapore and I will definitely keep coming back for more.

caption: Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ  I had an incredible time at Esplanade in Singapore! The public performance featuring Indian and Western music fusion was pure magic. The musicians' talent and synergy were awe-inspiring. The blend of ragas and Western melodies created an unforgettable symphony. The venue's acoustics were top-notch, enveloping us in a mesmerizing musical journey. A must-visit for any music lover!
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: At esplanade there is something free every day. You should check on their website. This month is ‚Äú jazz in July ‚Äú. the Sunday band was great
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Nice building, nice acoustic. Even if we're only strolling sround the outdoor area we still get a beautiful view of singapore's landscape. A lot of people jogging around here esp during afternoon to sunset.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: One of the best experiences in Singapore. With a touch of a classical music concert, Singapore symphony orchestra. Don't forget to check the area before or later. We came earlier and spent 1 hours walking around, get to the 4th floor and roof terrace! Looks very quite and hidden spot for perfect photos!
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: If you are into arts, music and looking for a place to relax, appreciate the vibrancy here in Singapore, make a trip down here. There are also local delicacies beside the Theatre. And in the event nothing interest you, take a stroll around Marina Bay.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: The architecture structure of Esplanade building is bold and unique.  Always love to come to this beautiful place to enjoy a concert or performances. The atmosphere is great!  Occasionally, you can catch some free performances or activities at the concourse.  Do note that the internet connection inside the concert hall or theatre hall is very poor.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Lovely place to go to enjoy arts and music especially during weekends as there would be programmes held for the public
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: - air conditioned comfort for taking morning walks when it rains, and surrounding spacious grounds when it does not, - convenient parking location if you are looking to get to Marina Bay basin across from MB Sands, - Toast Box, Subway, Coffee Bean eateries are housed within for hearty breakfast
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: This is my first visit to Esplanade Concert Hall. All I could say about my visit was extremely worth it! It was a very nice hall, easy to access with MRT, staff were very helpful with all the audiences coming in. I want to come again!
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: I went there with my parent for the concert that they wish to have. There are lots of performance and exhibition here full with arts. However I heard from my mum the theatre where they watched the concert doesn't have the big screen at the side of the stage (which we normally have during concert) in which really surprised me.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: I was lucky to catch one of their night shows while walking from merlion park. They showcased several opera singers who gave their rendition of famous classical pieces. The show was free and everybody was welcome. Overlooking the marina bay sands and singapore skyline. Don't miss this!
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: The theater is spacious with decent sitting arrangement with beautiful interior. The audio system was great too for concert. I had a good time attending concert Belagu by Dayang Nurfaizah, a Malaysian A-Class singer.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Nice place to visit i Singapore if youre looking to experience the arts. They have daily performances that you can freely watch. The place also have alot of restaurants.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: One of the iconic buildings of Singapore, the Esplanade. Durian shape like building and if you are a fan of art and performance, this place is not a stranger to you.  There is weekly outdoor performance and its free. Grab yourself a drink and sit by the outdoor theatre space with the Marina Bay area as the backdrop.  After your musical treat, be sure to walk over to merlion Park.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Looks great. Strategic location. Unfortunately there's no performance to see on the day we arrived. The environment looks outstanding with several Singapore landmarks situated here..
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: I visited the place as a tourist so my impression is its cleanliness, fully equipped with toilet and even water for visitors. The architecture is also interesting which resembles a durian. Everything is lovely. Definitely a must see spot once you come to Singapore.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Tbh I didn't enter to see what's inside, but I was enjoying the malay performances near the esplanade. Unfortunately it was their rehearsal and the real performances will commence once we've left on the next day.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Esplanade is the symbol of culture of Singapore. It is a one stop that is connected with Suntec, Raffles City, Marina Square and Millennia Walk. The free indoor/outdoor performance is just amazing. This weekend in May-23, we had so much fun with the 3-metre seagulls that came from Australia. They are so cheeky and playful !
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Beautiful theatre and Arts Centre. Many activities going on when we visited. Great views from the roof garden. .
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: When im in there there is music concert, but it took so long tp start so i dont watch them, actually if i have time next, i'll go to see them
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Came here and there was a free event showcasing musics and performance from around the world. From different cultures and countries. Place is big and with a good view of mbs and a distant merlion in the outdoor area. Overall its a good theatre for performance.
name: Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay, Singapore

caption: Free performances on the weekend! That alone earns it 5 stars. High quality performances in both the concourse and outdoor stages. Make sure to check out the paid performances too. This venue outclasses many I have been to in North America and Euy.

caption: Was at the Esplanade for a show and it was amazing. Had a great view from Circle 3, though the banister did obstruct the view a little, but for safety sake I get it.  However the experience was almost ruined by one of the ushers on Circle 3 who treated my friends and I with such disdain and rudeness. Is it because we had coloured hair and visible tattoos? Didn't expect the older generation to still retain such outdated views that people with coloured hair and tattoos are troublemakers.  If any of you have visible tattoos or coloured hair, I highly recommend NOT going unless you want to be snapped at by the ushers.

caption: My Husband and I went to watch Dr Jason Leong's Brain Drain World Tour 2023 at Esplanade Theater on the 7th July 2023.  Beautiful, posh place, easily accessible via basement carpark or public transportation.  We had balcony seats again which were comfortable, cushioned armchairs that were totally movable and easy to position for a better view.  The Theater Staff and Ushers were helpful and very friendly.  My only grouse is that the balcony seats on both Circle 2 & 3 are not accessible by the elevators and we had to use stairs, which would be a challenge for patrons who have difficulties maneuvering up or down the stairs.

caption: 2 thumbs up for the place. At first I thought only a few hours would be enough but then we spent time here all day and my child had so much fun. Recommend for Mirror maze and phobia zone
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Educational and fun public space where young ones can learn science concepts visually while enjoying themselves. We particularly love the Butterfly up-close section (additional ticketing fee required) even though the space was small but packed with variety of butterflies. The maze was fun and easy to navigate. We only wish that the water playground could open a bit longer in the evening because of the scorching sun during late morning and afternoon.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Went there at Wednesday morning and bought the tickets at the entrance using iPhone. No Apple Pay, need to enter your card information. It will send QR codes to your email. One person per QR code. I was there at 9:57. Not too crowd before 10:40.  There are water play areas right next the the entrance. But we didn‚Äôt get to play in it since it was raining in the afternoon and they closed the feature.  It‚Äôs the best science center I ever been. With just regular entrance free, you can play mirror maze, typhoon simulator, earthquake simulator unlimited times.  There are shows, one is in the middle of the circle, one is at second floor robots show and fire tornados.  We spend 5 dollars extra for the lazer maze. You can play twice per ticket. The laser maze is suitable for 7up. Little kids is kinda waste of money.  We encountered couple school field trips. At least 4 tour bus. But it still manageable. Not feeling too crowed.  Restroom every where. Water fountain not working. Food court sell some hot foods.  Definitely worth to go as a tourist. My 6 and almost 10 year old sons enjoyed it. We stayed there for the whole day.  The only downside is that they don‚Äôt have physical map. And the digital one is really not a good UI for your iPhone,super hard to find your way.  If you bought an adult ticket, there is a 5 dollar shop voucher. Not for using it to buy food or drink.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Is bigger than I thought! Not enough to cover in 2 hour if you really do all the activities. $6 for adult and $4 for child is definitely very value for money.  There are various show at different timing.  Open carpark outside can get hot and troublesome if rain.  There is stroller for rent at $6 or free for member.  There is a small eateries that sell local food like mee siam, macaroni coffee and sandwich for quick bite.  Another proper restaurant call stellar kitchen outside at main entrance.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Kids loved the butterfly garden where butterflies could land on them, the place is huge so 2.5hours was not enough!  1140am there was a show on second floor And 12nn had an excellent show with a wonderfully engaging presenter !  Well done Science Centre It‚Äôs tough for those in the east side to come but glad we did and we must bring water gear to play in the outdoor water playground after!  We came on mar school hols
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Educational and fun for all ages! My uni friends and I had a blast here exploring all of their tinkering eorkshops, exhibits, and activities.  Friends and family can definitely spend their whole afternoon here. We find that 3 hours still isn't enough!  The entrance has many optical illusions which they helpfully explain. You can take many silly photos here and learn these visual phenomenons.  Their tinkering workshop lets you build your own graphic cubes, hot air balloons, and marble pathways which is so interesting! They supervise your glue gun and drill usage so it is very safe.  Their phobia exhibit is short but fun. I especially like their scream booth and their clowns!  Their mirror maze is a must-see! Fun to get lost inside for the kids.  They also have a poop exhibition, cryogenics (must pay), climate change, electricity, and many more.  I think their dialogue with time is also very fun to accept ageing and raise awareness. Ageism is real in Singapore!  Their biology segment could use some work. No one was there cause it was all boring infographics and no actual interactive activities! Their VR segment was cool but it was meh compared to other exhibits.  Some machines and activities are not working which is a bit of a pity too!  Outside, their kinetic garden is very pretty and you can produce musical notes with just some pipes and a slipper üòú.  Definitely come here on a weekday for FREE entry, or during the weekends since its so cheap anyways!
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: A great place to be for all kids. Plenty to see, learn and experience. Staff are all very friendly and helpful.  Thank you for putting up 2 signboards near the entrance. I  understand they were put up about a month ago.  I snapped photos of the 2 signboards - one showing a sitemap ( helped guide me around the place at ease) and the other one showing highlights of activities held at each hall.  Today (27 May 2023-Sat) we met lovely 14YO Yeshicaa from India who is on 2 months holiday here.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Very innovative and interesting place to visit. Since I am not into science and stuff so could not like this place too much but still find very interesting things there to try out e.g earthquake, cyclone, tornado etc.. staff is very helpful.. If you are into science and stuff you gonna love this place and can easily spend one day there.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: The trip on Science Centre Singapore was very interesting. There were several themes in different areas inside. However, I could only visit the ground floor because I had to rush back to Orchard Road due to my traveling plan.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Great amazing place for kids. Very clean n huge. A lot of exhibitions. From Jurong east mrt, proceed to j cube, then straight passing housing complex. It is behind the housing complex. It will be better to buy the ticket beforehand.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Enjoyed my visit at the Science Centre Singapore. Always something new to experience & learn. Highly engaging for both young & old!
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Visited after 10 years and realised its changed significantly. So much to learn. Science Centre has kept up to date with latest developments in science. Must visit.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: I would say it's better enjoyable for kids than for an adult. But many scientific experiments where demonstrated which is knowledgeable and exciting for all to watch.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Interactive science centre.This review is for the centre only and not kidsSTOP. Had brought kids here a few times this year to the Science centre and it was fuss-free to enter without any queue even on a weekend. They have several exhibitions going on and a few permanent exhibits that we will see everytime. A few we enjoyed are "Dialogue with time-Embrace Ageing" ,  "Earth alive" and "Know your poo". The kids enjoyed the Waterworks playground too,which is also included as part of the admission ticket. Overall,an enjoyable and fun day trip to the science centre.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: I booked in for the science centre, kids stop and movie show.  My kids ages are 8, 6 and 5 months. We got there about 12pm and left at 5pm.  1. There was so much to do that 5hrs was still not enough. 2. Shame that it was a rainy day, so we missed out on the water play area. Truth is, we have to get there at 10am opening time to be able enjoy and not rush through everything. 3. Love the fact that the museum is engaging  for all different age groups. 4. I was busy feeding my baby so the staff at kids stop looked out and entertain my 6 year old and making sure she was safe. 5. For the Omni theater, I booked '3 2 1 lift off' because it's cartoon. I've seen parents with little kids that booked nature or planets, they came out of the theater earlier. Think about what your kids want instead of yourself.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: You should spend min half day to explore the whole center - multi entry allows so you can go to snow city or omni theater in between
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: A great and educational day out for the whole family.  It's better to block out a whole day for this visit as there is a lot of content alongside the optional movie and butterfly garden.  The Kinetic Garden outside the Science Center deserves it's own special mention at an attraction.  Worth a visit for budding kids interested in STEM or even adults who geek out on tech.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Has not been here for a long time (when i was still a school boy), but still stirring the science vibes in me when I visited. Cover a wide range of science topics and there are scheduled science shows too. And water play as well.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Been here many times, and the place starts to feel dated as you see most of he same exhibits each time. For first timers, surely this place will excite you and there is lots to learn surely. I hope they would consider renovating the place or think of newer exhibits to replace the old ones.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Great place for kids and young (at heart) scientists!  Lots of things to learn and play with, very interective exhibitions. (Some were brokens but most were still good.) Our daughter loves mirror maze the most.  Omni-theartre is also good experience.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Tickets are only available online. You can prepare extra outfit for kids to do outdoor water play. Our 7 years old loved this place, we easily spent 3 hours here. Kids liked the mirror maze, poo poo knowledge and typoon experience the most. There is a small outdoor restaurant where it serves fried chicken and fries or laksa that you can grab for lunch.

caption: I had so much fun at science center. Such an interesting place to visit with plenty of interactive displays in SG, especially at bad weather. The ticket is quite cheap. Omni-theater is cool but the movie is not interesting enough for me. The place closes quite soon, at 5pm
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: There are new things to explore such as the earliest sanitation used in Singapore and "Tinkering" exploration space.

caption: Went in at 10am. As we left the place realized that our girl lost her phone. The staff were understanding and let us in again no questions asked. Everyone was helpful, especially the flight simulator crew. They actually did a check of the place. Eventually it was turned in by a staff member to lost and found. Thank you all for your integrity and help!
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: My advice: take a few pictures outside, let the kids play the playground BUT don't buy tickets and DON'T go in. With the money you saved, go to the coffee shop directly opposite and enjoy the Mookata. Kids will love it.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Don't expect to see scientific breakthroughs or seminal discoveries.  This aging place is one of the few places in Jurong that have seen better days.  Archaic and uninspiring displays provide little educational or inspirational opportunities. Perhaps low - or no-cost tour operators still find this place useful.  For parents of today's internet savvy kids, the value of a visit is doubtful.  The good news is that the place is due for a move - sideways.  Hopefully, a makeover will ensue.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Visiting from Canada. This is one of the best science centres I've visited. It seems particularly well suited to science instruction, not just visits for curiosity. Well laid out with lots of space, and room between the exhibits, which are well constructed. A good distribution of eating places and restrooms to allow for school groups. The topics are well handled with solid strategies to engage students, and there are sections upstairs for particular instructional activities. Best to get tickets online in advance, although we got excellent help from the service office as we hadn't. A good place to visit if you like science, are interested in science education, or have kids of any age. There's also an excellent location (Stellar is its name and is its quality) if you need a place to have a bite or drink away from all the excitement. Overall a great, high value experience.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: The best museum in SG. Interactive experience kids definitely love it.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Good place, very polite and friendly staff who are always happy to guide and help you.Must take your kids here to learn different things in a more interactive way and will surely develop interest in science. Make sure you visit early as it's very huge and you might miss many things. There is a shop where you can buy science kits and toys.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: It was an awesome place to visit with kids. Worth spending a day with kids there.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: It is very good. It has a great place to learn and interesting things to do. There are mazes and even a water park. The place is very big too. Over all is great recommendation if you have no where to go

caption: Worth the value especially if you are Singaporean or PR as it's free. For tourists it's $12 for adults and kids above 12 and $8 for kids. We had a great time. The only thing that was not free was the laser maze. We spent all day here.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Many experiences for children. Too bad centre closing time is 5pm but most exhibits closed for entry by 4.45pm. Not sure if this is proper operations happening at a paid attraction if you're paying for closure at 5pm.

caption: It is a very attactive place for kids from 2-14 years old even adults.From the experience of touching, watching, listening , operating,experiments, lectures and playing in many different way, they learn much chemical, physical, biological and geographic phenomenons and the theories behind the phenomenons.
name: Science Centre Singapore

Again, information is not very clear. We did research and visited their website before coming here, but still confused as hell. We left without doing anything

caption: The Science Centre Singapore is a leading scientific institution located in Singapore. It is a popular destination for science education and exploration, offering a range of exhibits, interactive displays, educational programs, and events.  The Science Centre Singapore aims to promote scientific literacy and curiosity among visitors of all ages. It provides an engaging and interactive environment where people can learn about various scientific disciplines, technological advancements, and their impact on society.  Here are some key features and attractions you can find at the Science Centre Singapore:  1. Exhibits: The centre houses numerous interactive exhibits covering a wide range of scientific topics such as physics, biology, chemistry, astronomy, and environmental science. Visitors can explore hands-on displays, simulations, and demonstrations that make learning engaging and enjoyable.  2. Omni-Theatre: The Science Centre's Omni-Theatre is a dome-shaped IMAX theatre that showcases breathtaking science and nature films on a massive screen, providing an immersive viewing experience.  3. Snow City: Snow City, located within the Science Centre Singapore, offers visitors the opportunity to experience sub-zero temperatures and enjoy various winter-themed activities like snow play, snow sculptures, and snow slides.  4. Kinetic Garden: The Kinetic Garden is an outdoor exhibit space where visitors can explore interactive displays that demonstrate principles of energy, motion, and forces.  5. Observatory: The Science Centre Singapore houses an observatory equipped with telescopes, allowing visitors to observe celestial objects and learn about astronomy.  6. Educational Programs: The centre offers a range of educational programs, workshops, and science-related events catering to students, educators, and the general public. These programs aim to enhance scientific knowledge and critical thinking skills.  7. Innovation Maker Space: The Science Centre's Innovation Maker Space provides a platform for visitors to engage in hands-on tinkering and creative activities, promoting innovation and design thinking.  The Science Centre Singapore is an excellent destination for individuals, families, and school groups interested in exploring and learning about science in an interactive and engaging manner. It serves as a hub for science education, inspiring curiosity and fostering a deeper understanding of the world around us.
name: Science Centre Singapore

caption: Weekdays visit for Singaporean is free. Just "purchase" tickets in advance and show your pink IC at entrance will do. Avoid 12.30-2.15pm (or you can eat lunch inside) as most shows/activities are not available during this timing. Love the fire tornado show and escape room the most.
name: Science Centre Singapore
